It was if everything was happening in slow motion, you had not fully appreciated how huge Shadow was in comparison to you, as you saw huge strands of black fur fly past you as you descend near his legs. Taking a brief moment to look up, you see the legs stretch to the sky, with the upper half of Shadow appearing as a dark blur as his head blocked the sun. Before impact, you enter a parkour roll and land without injury. Upon falling to the ground, you leave your crouched position with a sprinted run.

Shadow’s quills began to tense with fury at the prospect of you rejecting his aid.

“You know, it could be considered insolent to turn your back on the Ultimate Life form when he is in a rare generous mood. I think I have a place for you to travel, a place where I could teach you that.” said Shadow, while slowly bending over to undo the buckle on his left shoe…

You were not paying attention to Shadow’s words, as you began to run with all of your might, jumping over lumps and rocks in the ground (Which, unfortunately, you knew to be pebbles), while frantically panting due to fatigue.
After unbuckling his shoe, Shadow looked up to make sure you had not gotten anywhere out of his sight – In the past minute you’ve had to run away, you’ve only managed to run around 3½ feet away from where you started. Smirking at your feeble attempt to escape, Shadow began to remove his shoe and peel what seemed to be black cotton socks off of his foot.

“You want to run? Let’s run...”
13331.title: Shadow's shoes.

choices: Shadow pins you to the ground.
133311.content:
After tucking his sock into his shoe, Shadow purposefully held it up to be equal height with his head, stretched his arm forwards in your direction and dropped it 8 normal inches behind you, creating a tremendous earthquake and making you lose your footing, falling face first into the ground.

“Heh, too easy. Okay, then, I’ll make this less difficult for you. I promise I won’t run, but you can feel free - Actually I’d advise you – to run as fast as you possibly can, for the Ultimate Lifeform does not tolerate impertinent pests such as yourself.”

You didn’t need to be told twice, as a matter of fact you resumed running as soon as you got back up! Still, Shadow’s speech was foreboding enough to refresh your tired body.

“That’s right, little ant, flee. Flee for your life.”

Shadow grinned maniacally at the prospect of hunting you down, toying with you, allowing himself to physically express his superiority as the Ultimate Lifeform. His body tense with a mixture of fury and excitement, he slowly lifted his left, bare foot higher than normal – up to his right leg’s kneecap – and moved it 9 inches ahead of him, and after 5 seconds of leaving it in the air, Shadow brought it down, stomping as hard as he could on the ground.

BOOM!

After another abrupt earthquake that nearly reduced you to your knees, you swayed to your right, nearly falling over before regaining your footing and continuing your escape. You quickly look behind you to see what had happened. What seemed to be 100 yards (Which was really 5 feet) away from you was a giant white and red structure that you recognized as the shoe, and looking up you could see Shadow’s face, which seemed to be hundreds of miles away, towering above you with cold, emotionless eyes, and a menacing grin upon his face.
But the thing that really sparked your panic was adjacent to the shoe, a large, black hill with 5 mounds of black fur, descending in large to small from right to left. With two red stripes streaking down the side of the hill, you immediately understood that this hill was connected to Shadow’s leg.

“This is amazing…” thought Shadow. “Finally, a creature that suitably fears and respects me as I deserve. Perhaps if he gives me a good game, I might not destroy him after all.”

Again, Shadow lifted his foot. This time it was his right foot, with a shoe still on. After lifting it to his left kneecap, he moved it 9 inches in front of him, waited for 5 seconds, and stomped down as hard as he could, causing dirt which looked like a blast of sand to shoot out from under it.

BOOM!

This time, as you were looking behind you, you did fall. Falling in a sideways motion, you rolled on your side, causing several small scratches against the rocky ground – Not deep enough to draw blood, but they still stung. Landing in a position that still faced Shadow, you could see he was raising his left, bare foot into the air again, at kneecap height, waiting. Looking up at him, you could not deny to yourself that if this was not a matter of life and death scenario, you’d probably enjoy it!
Deciding to wait for the next tremor to pass, you looked in horror as Shadow wiggled his toes, causing debris from underneath his dark grey soles to plummet to the earth, like a rain made out of dust and rocks, some bigger than you! After a period of 5 seconds, he brought it back down to the earth, the shock of it making you bounce an inch from the ground.

BOOM!

“He is indeed giving me good sport, but not nearly fast enough to evade me. I’d relish the chance to punish his insolence and satisfyingly end this vermin’s life.” thought Shadow the Hedgehog. “But, if I crush him, how else can I possibly continue this euphoric feeling of superiority? While I can outmatch any rival, I cannot impose this authority upon them, this control…”

Moving his body weight fully onto his left foot, he raised right foot into the air as if taking another step, so nonchalantly as if he was taking a normal walk. If it were not for him looking at you, it would have been possible he had lost your location. His face smiled at your expression of horror, and his expression became lustful and wanton. Recognizing your longest period of stable running, you sprang up and sprinted again.

“It would seem he has failed to evade me - at my current walking speed, my next step will tread over him with my right shoe, crushing him.”

Shadow began to lift his right foot to his left kneecap, moved it 9 inches ahead of him, so the middle of the shoe was directly above you, and waited for 5 seconds.
You began to look frantically around for somewhere to hide, somewhere he could not get you. Maybe a small cave, or a hole? Anywhere was better than being in the open, when he was so close to you! He was no longer miles away from you – In fact, you believed he was just over 1 regular foot from crushing you. Even though the process of him lifting his feet and waiting spread over 10 seconds, he was still advancing on you faster than you could possibly match.
A dark rectangular shadow fell upon you as if the sun had been blotted from the sky, stretching ahead of you, at twice your running speed until it suddenly stopped moving, staying perfectly motionless. Knowing that the next 5 seconds were your last chance, you sprinted as fast as you could to escape the darkness surrounding you, illuminated ground mere moments away, until suddenly…

BOOM!

An explosion of dust and debris shot from underneath you as you barely managed to run from underneath Shadow’s shoe before it collided with the earth. The shaking earth and force of wind that escaped from beneath his shoe caused you to shoot 6 feet (From your perspective) into the air, to which you landed on your feet and kept running.
“He’s right behind me, he’s going to crush me!” you think to yourself. You could tell that time was running short from the huge explosion that had occurred right behind you.

“Hmph! I thought I had you there, but it seems your luck has run out.”

Fatigue was heavily slowing you down, and you couldn’t keep up the same speed you had when you began. Clumsily running, your throat dry with exhaustion, you frantically look around for some way for you to escape or hide. The sun was beating heavily upon your back, until it suddenly stopped. Only then did you realise that the sun had been blotched again. Looking in front of you, you could see that darkness covered the ground like a small island, with a large peninsula, with 4 adjacent narrowing peninsulas, allowing four pillars of light to creep between them.

“Game over.”

BOOM!
133311.title: The hunt is on.

1333111.content:
A tremendous weight falls diagonally on your back, causing you to fall forward to the ground. The air is squeezed from your lungs, and while you feel the earth quake, you remain stuck exactly where you are. The tremor was not as violent as the previous ones, implying that Shadow had purposefully been lenient and had not stomped with his full potential force. Abruptly, the sweaty, rough texture behind you moved to the right, the friction causing you to flip over. The pressure increased suddenly and decreased several times in a swaying motion, forcing you into the ground. Suddenly the dark grey leathery surface raises into the air and repositions itself, placing you in the groove between Shadow’s two smallest toes.

Pressing down with his toes, he forces each digit, damp with sweat, to slowly, painfully drag across your body. When you reach between his two largest toes, they slightly separate but still trapping your legs. Blinding sunlight enters from the crevice above you, its dark grey walls shimmering with small beads of sweat in the light. Surprisingly, in-between Shadow’s toes had remained relatively clean in contrast from the underside of his sole, which was now covered in dust and pebbles.

Your eyes finally adjusted to the light, allowing you to see the blue sky, and you calm down enough to appreciate your surroundings. Looking around, it would seem you have found yourself in another cavern – apart from the separation in the 2 toes, the dark grey ceiling descended down to the ground around you. A bead of sweat dropped onto your head, causing you to look up at the sun which was promptly blotched by Shadow’s face, who was bending over to get a better view of you.

“Hmph, enjoying yourself? I hope you’ve had as much amusement as I had. I congratulate you on your stamina, I expected you to falter after my third step. I was certain I would have got you with my fourth, but you managed to take a full 5 steps. Still, I don’t see any reason as to why I should let you remain alive. Any last words?”

You begin to flail your arms around, pleading with your dry croaky voice, although all Shadow could hear of your protests were small faint squeaks.

“I’m going to assume you want to live. Very well, I’ll spare you on one condition. It would seem I have saved your life twice; once by offering my aid, and the second being me sparing you now. Therefore I demand complete obedience from you, to do whatever I desire. Fail and there will be no mercy for you.”
"If you decline, do nothing and I’ll finish taking my next step.” Said Shadow as his 2 toes sealed together and fell down on your face, forcing you into the ground while the cavern flattened as he applied more pressure onto you.
“If you consent, pledge your fealty and dedication. I’ll leave that up for your imagination.” The pressure relieved to what it previously was, reforming the appearance of a dark grey cave.

You obviously wish to consent – Anything is better than dying like this! You begin to sit up, with your legs still beneath Shadow’s sole while your head reaches halfway out of the toes crevice. You begin to look around the cave frantically for some way to show your consent, while gagging as you notice the acrid scent that smelt like vinegar emanating from the glistening crevice. You hear a deep cough echo above you, so you look up to see Shadow’s face with a skeptical expression, raising one red eyebrow – looking down at you if you were the biggest idiot on the planet. Suddenly, he flexes his toes, causing the skin in between them to bulge out towards your face.

“You have 3 minutes.”

Grasping the hint, you begin to clean. Using your hands, you wipe away the sweat that is adjacent to your head, causing the crevice to become less glistening, and more like a surface. After 30 seconds of wiping away the sweat with your hands made you become damper then you already were, to the extent that your hands would rub the sweat around rather than remove it. Your sleeves were drenched by several stray droplets that fell down your arms.

After 1 minute and 13 seconds, the majority of your upper torso was drenched, making you wonder if you could continue. Deciding to rub your hands on the ground in an attempt to dry yourself, you continue with little success, doing your best to ignore the urge in your groin…

After 1 minute and 48 seconds of smearing sweat, you successfully clean from the tip of the crevice to the sides of the base, only leaving the skin that connected the 2 toes glistening with droplets. Hearing a booming voice, you look above you.

“It seems you have done an acceptable job, but you still have not pledged fealty nor dedication. So try and think real hard. I’m sure you’re thirsty.”
Not understanding what he was trying to hint, you stare at him. Shadow groans in frustration, flexing his toes again, causing the skin between them to bulge out.
“Use your arms again, and you will lose them. You have 1 minute.”

Comprehending the command, you begrudgingly look directly in front of you, at the dark grey skin. The reason why you left this bit to last was because it was the most shimmering part of the crevice – The wettest. “Well, I am thirsty…” you console to yourself. Suddenly, a large booming noise occurs from above you.

*COUGH* “I’m waiting.” said Shadow as a stomping sound began, which you knew to be his shoe.

Acknowledging that 10 of your 60 seconds had passed, you abruptly open your mouth wide, move your head towards the skin, and stick out your tongue so a large bead of sweat could move along it, into your mouth. The scent of it was nothing compared to the taste. It was as if you were drinking a strong, mature cheese mixed with the slight taste of vinegar, like cider. After swallowing it, you could not resist returning for a second taste. Forgetting of Shadow’s presence, you ravenously swallow as much of it as you possibly could, taking huge mouthfuls of the substance, occasionally swishing some droplets in your mouth as if it was some fine vintage.

“10, 9, 8…” came the voice from above you.

Noticing that Shadow was counting down how much time you had left, you snapped back into reality to find your job was nearly finished. Taking a brief look above you, you noticed Shadow was taking off one of his gloves. Only several beads remained, the rest of the area where you licked still looking damp due to saliva, but not shimmering as Shadows sweat had done. Moving as fast as you could, you slurped each individual bead up until only one remained.

“4, 3, 2…”

Realizing how little time you had left, you jerked your head forwards, attaching your mouth directly over the bead. Sucking, slurping and slightly chewing on the skin, you attempt to finish your job until…

“Time’s up, human.”

A huge dark grey pillar with a streak of red blocked the light and entered the crevice, forcing you to the ground. Noticing it had a nail, you recognize it as Shadow’s finger. It twisted left and right until it ascended from where it had come from. Bringing the finger up to his nose, Shadow smelt it.

“Well, the small amount of liquid here is not mine, which makes it seem you have succeeded. As I mentioned, I desire to return home, which means you will need a mode of transport. Luckily, I’ve thought of a place where you may become more humble.”

Twisting his foot, Shadow turns you over, forces your waist between his toes and lifts you up, torso dangling below as Shadow began walking back to where he had started. Whenever it was time for him to walk with his left foot – the one that held you – he would perform it slower and gentler than his right, causing you a painless ride, but still walking at a regular pace and fashion. Unfortunately, you still suffered from the vertigo of being held face down every time he took a step, feeling sick as you were pulled into the sky and then forced back into the ground.

While walking towards a small rock, Shadow bends over and picks up his shoe. Sitting on the rock, he places his foot on his right leg, takes you out from between his toes and places you on the tip of his right shoe. Wiping off the dust and dirt that had collected on his left foot, he lifts up his left shoe, pulling the sock out of it. Holding one in each hand, he looked to be weighing them while trying to come to a decision. With a grin on his face, he snatches you up and places you…
1333111.title: Shadow pins you to the ground.

choices: Do you want a closer look?
Lets go see Tails, He might be able to fix this.
134.content:
After the flash ,you had a dream, You were floating in space surrounded by stars and planets
alike, below you was a planet that you had never seen before, it looked like Earth (Or photos
you had seen of Earth) However you knew that it wasn't. The planet was blue and green, but
the green was a bit too green and the blue was a bit too blue. Suddenly the planet began to
expand and contract, changing size with every movement, it was certainly a sight to behold.

The planet stopped all motion for a while. Suddenly it started to expand rapidly, growing
larger and larger until it was the only thing filling your vision. You noticed it beginning to
encircle you, all you see in any direction is blue and green. You then see a dot, a mere
pinprick of red. At first it was barley noticeable, but little by little it began covering all of
the blue and green, until the only color of the once distant blue and green was red.
You couldn't even begin to fathom what this meant, but you were aware that you were
dreaming the whole time.

You remembered hearing something about this, being aware of dreaming while dreaming,
but you didn't really believe it could happen, let alone happen to you. You then noticed a
white symbol that resembled a crescent shape begin to form and then you woke...

Looking around you could see you were no longer in your living room, but where were you?
You slowly sit up and look at the floor, a magnificently white fabric stained hear and there
with brown, a small tear in the fabric revealed a red floor underneath. "How strange," You
thought to yourself. Your thoughts, however, were cut short when you looked up, staring
you in the face, was the face of Knuckles the Echindna.

"I was wondering when you were going to notice me," He says. You take another look around
and you realize that the land you were sitting on was the palm of his gloved hand, no wonder
why the floor was giving off such heat. You look up and ask him, "How did I get here?"
He answers, " I don't know, I only found you on the floor a few minutes ago, You almost ended
up a red stain on my red foot," You go to the side of his palm and look down at two massive red
feet. You look up at him, and he smiles, "Yeah, long way down huh?" You nod and say "Yeah,
but now what?" He answers:
134.title: Big Red

choices: Answer him. Any help you can get is worth the risk.
Don't say anything. You can figure things out when he leaves the room.
1351.content:
Slowly, your senses begin to come back to you. Before you open your eyes, you feel something soft and cushiony underneath your body. Itâs warm and comfortable, covered with some kind of fabric that you thought were sheets. Whatever it was, it was silky smooth against your face, and you rub your cheeks against it as you began to regain consciousness. You breathe in deeply through your nose, stretching your shoulders and scrunching your face to try and wake yourself up. You smell something musky, like sweat or something, but youâre in too much of a daze to think too hard about it. You turn onto your back and stretch your arms and legs. You feel your body respond to the increased circulation and the fog of sleep slowly drifts away.


         You move your arms and attempt to sit up, when you come to a sudden realization. The last thing you remembered was starting up your Genesis console in your living room. If you passed out, how did you make it to your bed?


         You sit up quickly and open your eyes. It turned out you didnât make it to your bed at all.


         The view before you is barren of any objects, save for the white fabric that covered the floor. Just in front of you, a streak of blue about as wide as your shoulders stretches off towards the horizon. At the edge of the horizon, something reflective glistened, and after shaking off the momentary blindness, you noticed that it looks like a huge hill made of gold. Your vision clears, and you begin to make out more detail. The golden hill has some kind of strange blue markings on it. They glow with a faint blue light, which suddenly grows more intense. The light bleeds onto the blue line in front of you, and it begins glowing too.

         Suddenly, you donât feel the soft cushion beneath you. In fact, you donât feel anything beneath you. You wave your arms and legs in alarm, but with nothing there for them to grab on to, you only succeed in flailing around as uselessly as a fish out of water. You realize that thereâs an aura surrounding you; the same color as the light on the floor before. Everything takes on a bluish tint as your surrounded in the halo, but you can see out of it well enough to notice the wall ofâ¦what was that? It looked like the wall was covered in thin strands of some kind, like blades of grass. But they were just about as tall as you were. And they werenât green either. They lookedâ¦silver?

         Before you could figure that out, you feel yourself being pulled up by an invisible force. You have absolutely no control and you begin to panic at first, but once you soon realize that whatever is pulling you is doing it slowly. In fact, it feels downright comforting. Your view of the wall ofâ¦whatever it is pans upward. Now you just want to jerk your head up and see where your going, but the aura has you paralyzed.

         Soon, the silvery strands turn into a forest of thicker, white fibers. They are about as wide as your arm at their widest, and taper off at the end. From where you were, they look like someone took apart giant, puffy cotton balls and stuck them to the surface of the wall. You continue upward and the forest abruptly ends and a new shape appears. This one is smooth and colored like skin. In fact, the whole shape looks like itâs made of skin.

         Then it dawns on you. You next see a gaping hole, so deep that you canât see the back of it. You do see itâs slimy wet floor, though, as well as glistening white formations that look like carved rocks. A humid gust of wind hits you from inside the cave, but you remain perfectly upright as you float upwards. Next you see a black object that looks like a human-sized sausage sticking out from the wall. It appears slightly moist, like the nose of a dog, but your not paying attention long enough to get a good look. As soon as you clear black object, you see two gold-colored ovals only slightly bigger than you plastered on the white surface of the wall. But these things werenât just ovals. They were eyes.

         And they were staring right at your puny, insignificant form.

         You knew those eye anywhere. The pieces start falling into place as you suddenly realize what all that stuff was as you flew up here. The silver and white fibers werenât strange blades of grass; they were fur. And they werenât attached to a wall. They were attached to a body. All the rest were features of someoneâs face.

         No, it wasnât just anyoneâs face. It was the face of Silver the Hedgehog.

         Your mouth is wide open, from a million different feelings that you couldnât even begin to figure out. How did he get here? Why was he so big? Just what in name of the Seven Chaos Emeralds was going on here?

         Your thoughts are silenced by Silverâs booming voice. âHEY, ARE YOU OKAY LITTLE GUY?â

         His voice shakes you to the bone and made your ears hurt. You want to fling your hands up to cover your eardrums, but the aura prevents you from moving. When you finally un-scrunch your face, you look into his huge golden eyes. They appear to be filled with a mixture of intrigue and genuine concern. But youâre too confused and terrified to tell if he wants to hurt you or not. If you answer him, heâll know your alive and awake, which may not be a good thing if he decided to be less-than-friendly to your situation.

         Alternatively, you could play dead and not answer him at all. Maybe heâll put you down and lose interest, and then you can hide and figure out just what the heck happened in guaranteed safety.


What do you do?
1351.title: A Wall of Silver

choices: A mischievous smirk grows on his face. You may have made a huge mistake.
He looks confused more than anything else. Can he even help you at all?
13511.content:
âYeah, Iâm okay,â was all you could manage to mumble out. You were still hesitant about enlisting the behemoth hedgehogâs help, but the way you saw it, there was no other alternative. You didnât even know if you were still in your house anymore, nevertheless why Silver was a giant and holding you to his face. What possible hope could you have of solving this mess on your own, when just a short time ago Chaos Emeralds and anthropomorphic hedgehogs were about as real as a professional wrestling match? Things were obviously turned on their head, and if the situation was going to be crazy, you may as well embrace it.

         But truth be told, there was another, more mischievous reason for your decision to draw attention to yourself. Ever since he was introduced into the series, youâve had somewhat of a crush on Silver. Youâre not sure if it was his naivetÃ© and almost child-like sincerity towards almost everything he does, or his smoking body that was the hottest aspect about him, but either way youâve had a thing for the sexy hedgie from day one. And now you were at his total mercy; he could end you in an instant with a quick stomp of his massive boot or a squeeze the life out of you with his gigantic hand. For some reason, having gullible little Silver hold so much power over you was getting you pretty hot.

         Granted, you were still terrified for your life. Though if you really had to go, having your crush literally crush you to death sounded pretty appealing in your book. There were definitely worse ways to meet your maker.

         The titanic hedgehog stood motionless for a moment. You wonder what the problem was, and you panic at the thought that maybe he was thinking of what to do with you now that you were awake. Perhaps he wasnât as innocent as you thought. You break out into a sweat, when you see him tilt his head up slightly and line your body up with his mouth. You peer into his gaping maw, moist with saliva and dank with his musty breath. His mouth was opening quickly, and your gut reaction is to squeeze your eyes shut in preparation to the inevitable, but you kept them open anyway. If he was going to eat you, then you wanted to enjoy every second of being sloshed around in Silverâs mouth before he either chewed you up or swallowed you whole.

         Then, you feel a sudden gust of cold air at your back. Before you could react, Silverâs voice explodes out of the chasm.

         âHEY! I SAID ARE YOU OKAY?â

         Damn, that was loud. He was practically screaming at you, and you think to yourself that you wouldnât be okay for long if he kept on shouting like that. But it appears that he didnât hear your reply after all. That made sense when you thought about it; his ears were about thirty feet above you, and even though they were big, your voice would be meager by comparison.

         You want to shout that you are indeed okay, but before you can, you feel yourself gently float away from his face. He takes a few steps forward, which sound like crashing thunder with each foot fall, and then gently starts to lower you down. You were amazed at the kind of control he had with his telekinetic powers. You knew in the games that he had the strength to lift and hurl cars and robots with ease, so it was shocking to see that he could wield that power so delicately as well. You land on a hard surface, and the aura suddenly disappears, freeing you of your paralysis.

         Before you get up, you feel the rhythmic earthquakes as Silver walks away from you. You donât want him to get too far away from you, so you quickly get to your feet and start waving in his direction. But you stop in your tracks. This is the first time you got a real good look at your surroundings, and you donât like what you see.

         You were inside a house, but it wasnât yours and it wasnât normal sized. Just across from where you were standing was a sofa big enough to fill an entire stadium. You thought you could easily run a long oval across its three cushions like they were the track of your schoolâs football field. Since you were across from the couch, you figured out that you were standing on a long, rounded coffee table made of a dark brown wood. As such, you deduced that you were probably in the middle of the houseâs living room. You scanned around, and from where you were standing you could see a small kitchen area that looked hundreds of yards away. You couldnât see much else in there, as a wall cut off your view that probably led to a room or hallway of some kind on the other side. Opposite the couch was a TV that would dwarf the biggest Jumbotron you had ever seen. You scan right, and a book that was as thick as you were tall blocked most of your view, but you could see a door on the other side that was probably the main entrance to the house.

         Youâre relieved that Silver didnât walk that way; otherwise you may have been stuck in the house alone for who knows how long. You donât see the giant silver teen anywhere. After a moment of thought, you decide you have to do something to get him to come back. You may have been afraid before, but thinking on it you realize getting Silver involved was the right thing to do. Knowing him, heâd definitely help you out, if only he knew you were here.

         Then you get an idea. You go over to the book and run around to the other side. Thankfully, it was a hardcover and the pages were indented from the hard outer casing, making a little lip you could push on to get more leverage. You push with all your might, and pretty soon you are able to move the book a few feet (or inches, in your case) towards the lip of the table. With one final heave, you push the book off the table and make it crash to the floor with a loud thud.

         As planned, Silver came rushing in to see what the activity was all about. He floated in silently from the other side of the wall by the kitchen, arms raised in preparation for an attack. When one didnât come, he lowered himself to the floor and looked around with a confused look on his face. You jump up and down wildly, waving your arms and shouting his name. How he didnât see you right away was amazing, but this was Silver after all.

         After taking a few steps into the living room, his boot lands on the book you dropped. When he looks down to see what he stepped on, he sees you flailing around on the table. By the look on his face, he is totally shocked. You finally stop waving your arms, relieved that you can take a rest. Silver edges up to the table and kneels down on the balls of his feet to get a closer look at you. His titanic face became level with your tiny body, but his crown of hair stretched up into the sky like tall redwood trees. His sheer size still intimidated you, but there was no going back now.

         He knew you were here, and he knew you were alive. The question is now, what will he do with you?
13511.title: Ask and You Shall Receive

choices: He then lowered you to his feet
He then lowered you to his shoe

Damn it all! He was going to go out of the house, wasn’t he? Panic fueled questions raced through your pain-addled mind. How long was he planning on being out? Could you even take this misery long enough for him to find you? What if he doesn’t take his shoes off all day? What would you do then?

The momentary release of pressure that came did nothing to comfort your worries. You know what comes next now. Sure enough: another step, another bone-shattering weight pressing on your pelvis. This couldn’t be real. This had to be a nightmare of some kind. Your crush was quite literally walking all over you, and you could do nothing to stop it. Time passes, and you begin to lose count of how many steps your gray hero has taken. You’re a panting, sweating mess underneath his massive blue sock. It had grown considerably hotter inside the boot as Silver grew more and more active. His smelly sweat mingled with your own, and the cheesy aroma grew much more intense. Under any other circumstances, you’d be hard as a rock, but everything from the waist down had turned numb a long time ago. You still feel the pain with every step he takes, but your body is so spent that you don’t have the strength to react to it any more. You just let him pound you flatter and flatter with each footfall, resigned to your fate of never escaping this tortuous, noxious hell.

But then, the pressure releases. You instinctively wait for the heaviness to flatten you again, but it never does. Instead, you feel Silver’s foot wiggle above you, slathering you with sweat before dragging your exhausted body back towards the boots opening. Again, there’s no resistance from the insole, so you slide on it like wet rubber. When you reach what had to be the heel of the boot, the massive wall of blue finally lifts off of you and out into the blindingly bright world outside. Your lungs fill with fresh air for the first time in hours, and you gasp like you just came up from a diving expedition. What is his reaction?

1351122112211.content:
Without a sound, you gently float towards the bright opening of the boot. The sensation of levitating is soothing to your battered body. The comforting touch coupled with your intense fatigue is almost enough to lull you to sleep, but when the cool outside air hits your face, it’s like a defibrillator was put to your chest.

Your eyes take a moment to adjust to the new lighting. After blinking a few times, you can see that you’re outside, surrounded by an open, grassy field. A few delicate flowers poke out of the ground here and there, spotting the sea of green with white polka dots. In the far distance, you notice a line of trees stretching out to the horizon. Over one section of the forest, you see a column of billowing gray smoke slowly rise above the canopy. Above, thick gray clouds blot out the sun. As you stare at them, you can’t help but think that the clouds look the same color as Silver’s fur.

You hear a loud thud behind you. You want to turn around and see what it was, but the aura prevents you from moving anything besides your eyes. You gracefully come down onto a cushy white surface. Well, didn’t this feel familiar.

Silver put you down into his cupped hands; one nestled inside the other, as if to provide support. The green aura dissipates and you land on your feet, though since your entire lower half is still numb from all the crushing, your knees buckle from under you and you fall flat on your butt. It doesn’t hurt like you thought it should; apparently Silver’s gloved hands are softer than you remembered.

You’re finally able to turn to him, and when you do your heart breaks. His face is a collage of so many emotions that you had difficulty telling which he was trying to convey. Shock, embarrassment, worry and relief all vied for real estate on the young hedgehog’s face. He must have thought you snuck in there on purpose or something, to get your jollies on while he went about his day. You would kick yourself if your legs would respond to you. He’d forgiven you before, sure, but doing this so soon after the first time was a step too far.

But you didn’t get stuck in there on purpose. It was an accident. Unfortunately, you have no way of telling him that without your notepad. Was all that trust you built up with him suddenly going to fall apart just because of a misunderstanding? What are you going to do?

Silver’s timid voice breaks your train of thought. “Little guy…are you…you’re not hurt, are you?” His humongous gold eyes are constantly moving, presumably scanning your body for any kind of injury.

Great, you’ve made him feel guilty about your screw up. Damn it all, was there no end to the trouble you caused him? You try to get to your feet to show him that you’re totally fine, but your weakened legs refuse to hold your weight, and you topple down embarrassingly again.

“Oh, I know,” Silver says, attempting to sound able and collected but failing miserably. “I can get you some water. Just hold on, okay?”

It was only when he said that and glowed with energy that you realized you were underneath a massive oak tree. The trunk of the tree was about twice as wide as Silver. Looking up, branches covered in green foliage sprang out of the trunk for as far as the eye could see. It looked like an entirely different world up there, unlike anything you could have experienced at your normal height. You imagine darting around up there, looking out from the tallest limbs and seeing the whole world stretch out before you.

You see a nearby acorn glow and then snap off from the branch. Silver pops the top off of it with his psychokinesis and holds it outside the cover of the tree. You realize quickly that there’s actually light drizzle going on out there, and after a few minutes the top is filled with rainwater, and brought over to you.

You didn’t really think you were all that thirsty, at least until you had the water right in front of you. The acorn is the perfect bowl size for you, so in your ravenous state you guzzle the water down in mere seconds. You put the bowl down and take a few breaths when you see another float towards you. You guzzle that one down as well. As you drink, you catch a glimpse of Silver’s face. He looks mortified, and it seems like with every gulp of water you take, he gets even worse. After your third acorn-sized bowl of water, you shake your head and wave your hand to indicate that you’ve had enough. Silver takes the bowls away from you and chucks them onto the ground.

“Are you feeling any better now,” Silver asks. You shake your head yes, wanting desperately to try and stand again. You decide against it though, since failing again will probably only make Silver feel worse.

“I…I’m so sorry that I...I didn’t notice you in there.” His voice cracks as he speaks. He was really torn up about this, wasn’t he?

“You see, I heard that Eggman was attacking nearby, so I wanted to get here as fast as I could. I noticed you weren’t in your bed this morning, but I didn’t have time to find you…so I came here, and did what I had to do.” You remember the smoke rising from before. So that was the remains of one of Eggman’s schemes? Even though you didn’t see it yourself, you know that fighting Eggman would take a lot of physical activity. No wonder why it was getting so hot in that boot.

“Then, after the battle, I came in here to take a breather. It started to rain and everything, so I figured I could take a load off here. That’s when I took off my boot and found you.” He looked nearly on the verge of tears. It was ripping your heart apart at the sight of it, not just because your crush was upset, but also because he was blaming himself for something that was clearly your fault. If you hadn’t gone in that boot last night, none of this would have happened.

Seeing him nearly cry made you want to as well, but you had to be strong. He needed you to be okay now, for your own sake as well as his. He had the understanding to forgive you for your misdeeds. It was about time you returned the favor. With a look of rigid determination, you vigorously shake your head no. Then you point at yourself, attempting to convey that all this was your fault, and not his.

Unfortunately, Silver wasn’t having it. The sterling hedgehog wore his heart on his sleeve, and it showed in spades now. He averted his eyes when you looked into them, staring down and away from you and furrowing his brow like he was about to burst into tears. His cheeks turned bright red and his mouth quivered. To his credit, though, he was able to dam up the river of tears that seemed just about to flow.

He didn’t look back at you when he said, “No, little guy, it is my fault. I saw that you weren’t where I left you last night, and I didn’t look to see what happened to you. I should have known something was wrong, especially after I checked on you in the middle of the night and you were sleeping fine. But I was so focused on getting here.”

You hear a slight rubbing sound and notice that his bottom hand has tightened around the one you were sitting on. His eyes squint shut, and you can see his nose scrunch and his nostrils flair. Every time he takes a shuddering breath, your soul is crushed with despair. At this rate, you can’t guarantee that you won’t start crying too.

“I even felt you in there, too. I felt something in my boot as I was walking, but I didn’t stop to see what it was. I figured it was...I don’t know, something. I didn’t even consider that it could be you. Even after I knew you had a thing for my feet, I didn’t consider that you might have made it into my boots. I could have killed you, just because I was careless. What kind of protector am I if I can’t even keep you safe from myself?”

In spite of yourself, hot tears begin streaming down your face. God, he really did care for you didn’t he? If only you were normal size, you could hug him close and tell him that he didn’t have anything to feel ashamed about. You can’t honestly expect him to keep tabs on you 24/7, and he shouldn’t either. In fact, he showed more compassion than even you initially realized. Did he really check on you in the middle of the night while you were asleep? You feel sick to your stomach at the thought of your little spelunking trip. You deserved every crushing step you got while you were trapped in there, probably even more.

Silver starts to break down in front of you, and you feel more small and powerless than you ever had since you arrived in this world. You could do nothing to comfort him, not even give him a kind word to put him at ease. You’d get up to give his finger a hug, like you did yesterday, but your damned legs wouldn’t let you move. So you break into a sob too, for making Silver feel responsible for your actions and for not being able to help him through it.

Silver composes himself enough to say “Come on, you probably need some food and rest. I’ll take you home.” He takes his bottom hand and cups it over your head, encasing you in a gloved dome. Through the gaps in his fingers, you see his boot float up from the floor and onto his exposed foot. That must have been that thud you heard earlier; Silver was so overcome from seeing you in there that he immediately dropped his boot to the ground. Once it was on him and fastened, his entire young body glowed, and an instant later you were both flying at incredible speed.

Amazingly, you didn’t feel an ounce of acceleration as you flew. Silver must have been doing something to ensure the ride was as comfortable for you as possible. Thinking on it, you really don’t deserve someone as caring as him looking after you. You were a burden on him ever since you arrived, powerless to help yourself and powerless to help him. Between his fingers, you can see the entire world stretched out before you. What a bleak and terrible world it appears to be.

When you think about it, you really can’t remember the last time you ate something. Certainly nothing since you arrived in Mobius (well, unless you counted Silver’s foot sweat as food). Maybe a good meal was just what you needed to kick start your brain and come up with a good idea.

You both arrive at Silver’s cozy little home a few minutes later. Once you’re through the door, Silver lifts his hand off of you. You expect him to lift you up with his psychokinesis and place you on the couch, but the titanic teenaged hedgehog instead walks towards the kitchen area. He rounds the bend and enters a short hallway, then walks its length in about four steps and opens the door at the end on the right hand side.

The king sized bed, shimmering in glossy blue and white sheets, was the first thing to catch your attention. To your fatigued mind, it looks like a continent of warm, puffy clouds just waiting to cradle your worn out body. Silver floats into the room and places you gently on the building-sized pillow by hand.

“You can sleep in here tonight. I'll pull out a mattress and sleep on the floor next to you, so I can make sure you’re okay overnight." He smiles awkwardly down at you. It didn’t take a genius to figure out that Silver was still very upset about crushing you inside his boot. Your heart aches to see him like this.

“I’ll be right back with your food. You can eat it in here, if you want…” the silver-furred teen says, turning away without waiting for a response. He seems to leave the room faster than when he entered, and he practically slams the door behind him in his wake. You’re left totally alone, with nothing but the steady pattering of rain to keep you company.

In the solitude, you take better notice of your surroundings. Across from the bed is a long and low dresser, made out of black stained wood and standing at three drawers tall. Above that is a TV setup, a moderately sized flat screen hugging the wall with the box underneath. The remote is sitting on top of the box, something that strikes you as strange at first, but you quickly remember telekinetic powers of the room’s owner. The carpet is a steel gray in color, and though you have no way of feeling it for yourself, it looks incredibly soft from where you were sitting. You think of Silver running his perfect toes through the fibers of that carpet, and you can swear that you almost feel a tingle in your pants. Maybe the sensation was going to come back faster than you thought.

A few minutes later you hear the door creak open, and Silver floats in with a steaming bowl. You notice a wooden handle sticking straight up out of a thick mish-mash of meat, beans and sauce. The smell of savory meat favored with peppery spices hits the back of your throat and causes your mouth to water.

“I had some left over chili Sonic sent me not too long ago. I hope you like it spicy, because he sure does.”

You shake your head yes wildly, your stomach growling even more intensely as he brought the bowl closer. Silver levitates onto the middle of the bed. You see that he’s taken off his shoes and socks, though he doesn’t keep his gorgeous soles out for long; he tucks them under his butt as he sits on them. With the bowl in his lap, he manipulates the wooden spoon with his psychokinesis, stirring the contents of the bowl around and releasing puffs of steam and more of the delectable aroma. He takes a spoonful and floats it over to you.

You take a bite out of a piece of beef that was almost as big as your head. Not since tasting Silver’s sweat have you ever had anything so tasty. You gobble down a few bites like a ravished fiend, before you break away an allow Silver to pick up another spoonful.

You continue this process with him for a few minutes. He doesn’t say anything the entire time, and upon closer inspection he looks rather…sad actually. Was the very sight of you enough to put him through pangs of guilt? A pit grows in your stomach. No, you can’t have this happen. With your stomach quickly filling, your mind was starting to become clearer. What can you do to lighten the mood a little, and get his mind off of his guilt?

An opportunity arose when you heard a loud grumble. It’s as strong as a power chord played at a rock concert.

“Oh, sorry about that,” Silver says, blushing ever so slightly. “I guess I’m pretty hungry too. I’ll go get something.”

This was it, a way to show that you weren’t mad at him. You wave your arms wildly to get his attention. When you have it, you point to the bowl, then at him, then mime an eating motion.

His face actually lights up for a millisecond, before turning into a polite smile. “Thanks little guy, but I don’t want finish it on you. Don’t you still need to eat?”

You raise your one eyebrow at him. The bowl was about as big as a swimming pool, and you had barely even put a dent in it already.

“Okay, point taken. It was pretty good the first time around.” He loads up the spoon and levitates it up to his lips. He opens his mouth, and you see shiny strings of saliva connect his top and bottom jaws. His pearly white teeth appear for a second before he clamps down on the spoon. He drags it out and plays around with the food in his mouth, obviously savoring the delicious flavor. What if you were in with that food, getting slathered with Silver’s spit and getting tossed and turned by his tongue? Your spine shivers involuntarily, and this time you’re actually able to feel your member twitch. You were feeling better already.

You snap out of it right away when Silver says, “Wow, this stuff is good even a second time around. Did you like it too, little buddy?” His face was noticeably brighter; he appeared to light up the room even though he wasn’t physically glowing. You shake your head yes, immensely satisfied that you were able to break the ice.

Silver happily continues eating the chili, occasionally floating the spoon over for you to have some as well. In time, you get pretty well stuffed and stop eating, but Silver keeps on going. He strikes up a conversation almost immediately after taking his first bite, a decidedly one-sided conversation as all you could do was nod yes or no, but still. He asked you a bunch of questions about where you came from and what life was like for you back home, and you answered to the best of your ability, and Silver seemed genuinely pleased to hear about it. You even caught him smiling a few times. That warmed your soul like nothing else in the world. You were proud that your mission to cheer him up was a success, but even happier that you had the hedgehog you loved back.

Hours passed in what seemed like minutes. The chili bowl had gone cold long ago, placed on the nightstand with the bowl gently lying inside it. Silver was lying across the width of the bed, feet hanging off the side and head resting on his hand. When he finished his sentence, he turned over and saw the time.

“Wow, it’s pretty late. You really should get some sleep little guy, you must be exhausted.” He sat up and hovered off the bed. “I’ll just head inside and let you sleep.”

You quickly wave him down again. Instead of him leaving, you have a better idea. It was one you had ever since you saw him as a giant, and one you were itching to try out. You push both your hands down, indicating for him to sit again. He does, albeit with a curious look on his face. As soon as his but touches the bed, you signal for him to lie down. He returns to his original position sprawled out across the sheets. You try standing up, and though you do feel a dull ache when you get upright, you can still remain on your feet without issue.

Silver’s face widens in surprise, but he doesn’t say anything. You walk over to him as quick as your numb legs will allow, and once you reach his flat tummy, you give it a hard push. It doesn’t do anything, but Silver gets the message and lies down on his back. Once he does, you start climbing. Thanks to all the fur, it’s relatively easy to get up on top of him, though you think that having two properly working legs would help immensely. You make your way steadily across Silver’s body, enjoying every step you take on the gigantic hedgehog’s soft skin. You make your way across his slowly heaving chest; the trickiest area, as every breath Silver takes risks sending you careening back onto the bed. Finally, you reach your target.

You jump headlong into Silver’s puff of chest fur, arms wide and legs spread like you were doing a belly flop into a pool. The forest of thick hairs catches you and tickles your body as their feather-like tips run across your skin. You clamber up to the thickest section of the chest tuft and climb on top of it.

Silver’s face looms large over you. His massive bowline is furrowed into a worried shape and the edges of his mouth form a sad frown when he says “Uh…I don’t think it’s safe for you there, little guy. I mean, what if I hurt you again or something?”

You don’t pay much attention, because as soon as you get comfortable on a warm patch of chest fur, you are out like a light. You don’t even get to see Silver’s apprehensive look turn into one of pure love.

You awaken several hours later, right when dawn has broken. You wake up to the steady ebb and flow of Silver’s breathing beneath you, and the faint sound of his gentle heartbeat. You open your eyes, only to realize that you had slept the entire night on Silver’s chest. And not only that, but Silver had fallen asleep too. In fact, he was still asleep right now.

While sharing your food with him was a very nice gesture, you still didn’t cheer him up the way you really wanted to. And now that he was asleep, you had easy access to almost any part of his body that you wished. Maybe a pleasant wake up was just the thing he’d like. You know you’ll enjoy it.

135112211221113121.content:
It’s the smell of Silver’s fur infused into the pillow that finally wakes you up. You take a few deep breaths, and the distinct smell makes your eyes flutter open. Though no specific memory of him comes to mind, you picture him distinctly nonetheless.

You turn onto your back and sit up, scanning the area with a lethargic stare. Everything in Silver’s room is as you remember it. You were at the head of his bed, covered with a warm sheet up to your chest. Without thinking, you run your hands through your hair. Chunks of it are clumped together by something that feels hard and flakey. You suddenly remember what it is, and you jitter with delight.

You and your giant protector had gotten as close as you possibly could to having sex. In this very bed, you squeezed and rubbed the giant dick of your longtime hero, and together you shot off your loads until you collapsed from exhaustion. The memory is as crisp and clear as a movie projected before you, but you still find it too fantastic to believe. If it weren’t for the proof plastering your hair together, you would have dismissed it as just a vivid dream.

You get to your feet and stretch. It appears that Silver left you alone in his bed. He’s nowhere to be seen, but you do hear the faint sound of activity in the distance. As you look towards the open door leading out of his room, you see a huge book hanging precariously close to the edge of the bed. It seems like there’s a note on it, so you move closer to get a better look.

You realize the book was the same one you used to get Silver’s attention on the first day of your arrival. The yellow sticky note stuck to it reads, “KNOCK ME OVER WHEN YOU WAKE UP.”

Silver’s cleverness makes you smile. It looks like he was getting good at accommodating your needs, and it warms your heart to imagine him thinking of you so carefully. You walk over to the open edge of the book and brace yourself under its lip again. Using all your might, you push until the book slides off the bed and crashes onto the floor with a loud thud.

Like a charm, the signal works. You hear familiar crashing sounds begin softly in the distance, and then increase in volume as your giant hero approaches. The final thunderclap sounds just behind the doorways edge, and about midway up, a plume of light gray fur and glistening golden eyes pop into view.

“Morning little buddy. You look like you slept pretty well,” Silver says as he walks into the room. You see that he has his gloves on, and his feet are covered in a pair of cyan colored socks similar to the ones that you were very much accustomed to. He kneels down next to the bed, lining up his head with your little body.

You give him a wide grin and nod yes. Those humongous eyes of his dart around, more than likely taking in all of your tiny, naked form. With all that attention, you’d think you would feel a little bit self-conscious about your body. But you aren’t bashful in the slightest.

In fact, you feel the polar opposite. Without your conscious input, you stand up taller, puff out your chest, and spread your legs a little wider. A wave of confidence swells inside of you as he takes you in. After the time you had with him, you feel like you can conquer the world, tiny height be damned.

The titanic teenaged hedgehog smiles down at you. The warm expression is not unlike the sun’s rays hitting your skin. You feel your skin flush warm and red, and your stomach flutters with butterflies.

“You look like you could use a shower. I don’t think you’ve had one since you got here, right?” You nod your head yes, and Silver offers you his massive hand.

“Well come on, then. I just finished washing your clothes, so the sink in the kitchen is the perfect temperature.” Immature purity seems to pour forth from every pore as he speaks. It’s as adorable as it is sexy. You get onto his hand, and you both leave the room.

When you enter the kitchen area, you finally see what all the activity was about. There are pots and pans strewn about almost everywhere. The places that aren’t occupied by cookware accommodate a multitude of different ingredients. Eggs, bacon, sausage, pancake mix, butter, milk, and orange juice create a veritable rainbow of food on every countertop.

“Don’t mind the mess, little guy. I was just about to make us breakfast.” He looks down at you, again with that beautifully sweet look of his. “Don’t worry though, I can work around you, no problem.”

Looking at all the food makes your stomach growl. A good breakfast sounds great to you. Your hero stops in front of the sink and gingerly places you inside the basin. The drain is covered in a fine mesh, and after testing it to determine that it could hold your weight, you step into the center and line yourself up with the faucet above. Silver turns on the water, and a lukewarm stream washes over your head and entire body. The feeling is absolutely delightful.

Just before you get pruny, you step out of the stream and shake yourself off. Since you know Silver is busy, you clamber up onto the counter yourself. When you finally surmount the top, you go over to the tap and heave it closed.

“Breakfast’s gonna be ready in a minute,” Silver says, with his back turned towards you. He’s manipulating everything in the kitchen simultaneously with his powers, making the whole room glow teal. You feel dizzy looking at the complex arrangement, so you turn away and focus on the items in front of you. The towel looks incredibly soft and comfortable, and you can’t resist belly flopping onto it. You writhe around until you’re dry, and after fixing your puffed-out hair, you get into your clothes.

You wait patiently for Silver to finish what he’s doing before getting his attention. He’s only pushing around a few links of sausage in a frying pan when he once again lifts you with his powers and places you on the nearby dining table. You have your own place set out for you, adjacent to his.

Silver takes a seat and starts making his own plate, while simultaneously lifting food over to yours with his mental abilities. He’s quick to tell you that you don’t have to eat everything in front of you, which is a relief given the amount of food he has prepared. The teen must have been so excited for the company that he went a little overboard and prepared a feast. You wouldn’t be able to devour a tenth of it, even if you were lucky. Still, the sentiment was very touching, and you can’t wait to dig in.

Silver dices up your food into manageable pieces, and while he pours orange juice into a bowl near you, he says, “You know, I was thinking about something this morning, and I wanted to see what you think about it.” He finishes pouring and glances down at you.

“I still say the best shot at getting you back home is to find all seven Chaos Emeralds. The only thing is, I’m not quite sure where any of them are. If we look by ourselves, it may be a little while before we can find them all.” He forks a chunk of egg and puts it in his mouth. Between chews, he continues, “But I was thinking, if we get some of my friends to help us out, we’ll be able to collect them a heck of a lot faster.”

You mull it over as you take a chomp out of a strip of bacon. The "Sonic the Hedgehog" cast is filled with people who would probably help you out, if you told them your story. But then again, those were the characters you knew from the games and comic books. Who’s to say they would act exactly the same as those incarnations? Hell, this Silver loves having his feet serviced and just had sex with you; at this point, anything is possible.

You look up at Silver and see that he’s mulling over his options too. It’s only when you’re taking a sip from your bowl of orange juice that you hear him pipe up.

“I think the best thing to do is to start looking on our own. If we meet anybody along the way that might help us out, we can talk to them then. Asking everyone out the gate would just waste too much time.”

He looks down at you sidelong, and says with a smirk, “Besides, it’d give us more alone time together. Right, little lover?”

Orange juice sprays out of your mouth in a fine jet. You jerk towards him, and he gives you a cute, knowing wink before returning to his food. To think he would admit it so casually like that; he must have had a better time than you imagined. And “little lover?” Blood rushes to your cheeks and your knees gently wobble. You slurp up your juice slowly, letting the implications of that statement dance around in your mind.

When you calm down a bit, you agree to Silver’s plan. Doing it his way, you’d get the best of both worlds: he wouldn’t be burnt out from doing everything himself, and you both would get as much time together as possible. It’s a win-win, no matter how you look at it.

You both finish eating some time later, and your gigantic host gets right to work cleaning up. You’d eaten a heck of a lot more than you thought you would, and now you were stuffed to the brim. Just before you can lie down on the tabletop, Silver picks you up and levitates you onto the couch. He moves the TV remote closer to you and welcomes you to put on anything you’d like. Now that you think about it, you were curious to see what TV programs there were on Mobius.

You get up to press the power button, when there’s a booming knock at the door. You glace at it, then at Silver in the kitchen. He doesn’t look back at you; instead he stares fixedly at the door with an unreadable expression. The numerous plates and food items floating around him stop glowing as he places them on the countertop, and he floats across the room towards the door.

Silver hesitates a minute, then turns the handle. Before he can even open it fully, another giant figure barges into the house.
