1351122112211131212.content:
You’ve been in Mobius for three days now. In that short time, you’ve met the one hedgehog you had an immense crush on, got to rub his humongous feet, explore his incredibly hot body and, most unbelievable of all, have sex with him.

Well, what was probably even more unbelievable was the fact that you did all that stuff and he liked it. Your wildest dreams came true a hundred times over in the span of just seventy-two hours.

Yet even after all that, you still become star struck by what you see. You were a teenaged girl who had just met her favorite pop idol.

Sonic the Hedgehog was exactly the same size as Silver; every source you could think of confirms that fact. But as soon as he walked through the door, the sheer volume of his presence made him appear to be dozens of feet taller than he actually was. It was like he staked a claim to everything in the house just by stepping into it; and based on the look on his face, he knew it.

He stood tall in the doorway, one hand on his hip and a cocksure grin spread across his face. His greeting to Silver was as booming and massive as he was.

“What’s up Silver? Long time no see.”

You can’t see Silver’s face, but you notice his posture straighten slightly. He wasn’t quite standing at attention, but compared to his relaxed stance before, he may as well have been.

“Yeah, I guess so,” he says, flatly. “I did just see you yesterday, though.”

“True that. I don’t think Egghead knew what hit ‘em when you showed up to the fight.” He nudged Silver in the chest fur with his elbow, and chuckled a bit to himself. Judging by the way Silver was acting, you doubt he’d follow suit.

“Anyway,” Sonic says. “I gotta talk to you about that, but first…mind if I use your bathroom?”

Silver hesitates just a moment, then says, “Sure, go right ahead.” He then tilts his chin out the door, just behind Sonic’s line of sight. “You think Amy will catch up by then?”

Sonic’s eyes go wide and his face drops. He turns pale as a ghost as he whips his head around to look behind him.

The second he does. Silver flashes blue, and an instant later a freight train of air slams into your chest. You sink so deep in between the couch cushions that you can’t even tell if your eyes were open or still squeezed shut by the force of the impact. A few coughs rock your body before you can breathe again.

What the hell was that for? You want to clamber out and tell Silver off, but you stopped in an awkward position, and you have trouble righting yourself. Trying to fix yourself only gets you angrier, so by the time the teal light shines around you again and you’re hoisted up into the air by Silver’s psychokinesis, you’re absolutely fuming.

Before you can lay into him, he says, “I’m really sorry I had to do that little guy, but I didn’t have a choice. I couldn’t risk Sonic walking by and seeing you.”

Your one eyebrow lifts as you float onto Silver’s hand. You only now realize that he has a concerned look on his face.

“Look, I know you don’t really know Sonic or anything, but trust me when I say that this guy is bad news. I know for a fact that when he sees you, he’s… well he’s going to do whatever the heck he wants. Just like he always does.” He glares at the general direction of the bathroom like it just insulted him.

“I don't want that to happen to you. But don’t worry; I promised that I’d protect you, didn’t I? I’ll do everything I can to keep you safe.” His expression grows warm. The look is infectious; you find yourself smiling too.

Silver’s sentiment is sweet and all, but you’ve got to wonder if it’s really justified. In spite of what he thought, you probably knew Sonic better than he did. Yeah, the blue blur was brimming with self-confidence, almost to the point of narcissism. But you know that no matter how arrogant he seemed, he would drop the attitude in a heartbeat if someone were in trouble. He may have a high opinion about himself, but it’s never at the expense of others; unless, of course, those others happened to be portly doctors obsessed with world domination.

Was Silver being paranoid? There was a lot of stuff out there that you had to be protected from, you agreed with him there, but for Silver to feel the need to protect you from someone as heroic as Sonic? That’s a bit much.

Was Silver still not over the whole boot fiasco? You thought you were past that by now. Hopefully it’s got nothing to do with that event, and he’s just being cautious in the face of an unknown scenario.

From behind, you feel a sudden gust of wind, and before you can react Silver’s hand closes over you, and you’re thrown backwards. You land in the space between his fingers, and when you turn around and peer out the gap, you see that you are behind Silver’s back, just above his erect tail.

It sounded like Sonic was speaking through a megaphone right next to you when he spoke. “Ahhh, much better. Thanks dude.” There’s a momentary pause before he says “Hey, what’s that behind your back?”

“Uh…what?” Silver says. The ground beneath you gives way, and for a spit second you are in free fall as Silver raises his hands in front of him. Thankfully, you don’t fall very far before his psychokinesis catches you.

“I’m not holding onto anything…see?”

Jeez, this was bad. You knew six year olds who were better liars than Silver, and you think Sonic picks up on it, because he then says.

“Oh, come on. Now you’re holding it with your powers.”

“Uhh… no I’m not. I’m just doing the dishes. It gets done way quicker when I do them like this.” You glance over at the kitchen, and the plates and bowls he placed on the counter began floating like they had a mind of their own. The faucet turns on, and one by one they are doused with soap and water.

Nice save, oh clever protector.

“Oh,” Sonic says, a bit incredulously. “I guess it does. Say, it looks like you made a feast or something. A little hungry this morning, huh?”

“Well, actually I had some company this morning. It was…uh, Blaze. Yeah, she stopped by and I made her breakfast and stuff…”

Even though you couldn’t see his face, Sonic’s smugness was so pronounced that you could almost feel it coat your entire body in his oozy ego.

“Ohhhhhh, I get it. Finally puttin’ the moves on her, huh? Making her breakfast is a classic play dude; bet you scored some major points with that.”

“Yeah, well…you know, it’s only natural to do something like that for someone you…like a lot.” You can practically feel Silver blush as he said it. More than likely, it’s because you blushed too.

“Dawwwww,” Sonic says. “Did you tell her that? Because I bet you’d have gotten a BIG kiss on the cheek if you did.” Sonic chuckles to himself, and down on the floor, you see Silver’s giant socked feet shuffle nervously. If only you weren’t so small, you’d get in front of Sonic and…well you aren’t quite sure of the specifics. The fact that you can’t do anything right now pisses you off more than anything else, though.

“Anyway,” Silver says, obviously trying to sound unfazed. “What did you want to talk about?”

“Oh, yeah.” Sonic sounds composed, but there’s that lightness to his voice that still comes off as conceited. What was he getting at? “So you remember how you took down Eggman’s mech yesterday?”

“Well…it was kind of a team effort. I just came in and finished it off.”

“Right! And you know the rule we have about that, right? ‘He who busts it has to clean it up.’”

You hear a slap come from Silver’s forehead. “Oh crap, that’s right! I totally forgot!”

“Now, now, don’t worry, your best friend in the whole world took care of it for ya. And while I was doing your job in the pouring rain, I found this in the with all the junk.”

Suddenly, a bright white light bathes the entire room. You hear Silver gasp, and the aura around you instantly disappears. As dinnerware crashes in the background, you freefall a few more inches. Luckily, you’re able to reach out and grab onto Silver’s tail before you fall too far. He quakes underneath you from the unexpected feeling, but he doesn’t lift you back up. Instead, you straddle the extremity; scooting up to it’s widest part near Silver’s butt where you had the best balance.

“That’s…that’s a Chaos Emerald, isn’t it?” Silver was probably saying it for your benefit, and you’re so stunned that you almost fall off his tail.

“Heck yeah it is. I was going to keep it, but then I thought you might want it. I mean, technically it is yours, since you beat Egghead and all.”

“Yes, I want it!” Silver says, a tad too excitedly. Then you start to feel that clammy ego of Sonic’s drip over you again.

“Well…even though it should be yours, you didn’t hold up your end of the deal by cleaning up. Since I did, I think it’s only fair that I keep it.” Sonic was speaking in a singsong sort of way that made you want punch him in his nose. Where does he get off, anyway?

“But,” Sonic continues, “seeing as how you really want it, I might be persuaded to let you have it, if you do something for me.”

There’s silence for a few moments, then you hear Silver pipe up. “What do you want me to do?”
1351122112211131212.title: What are Friends for?

choices: Better safe than sorry; go find Silver while you have the chance!
That bastard deserved to have his feet creamed. You're happy to oblige.
An unforeseen circumstance chooses for you (Readers Choice)
13511221122111312121.content:
Silver must be just as shocked as you are, because he’s quiet for some time. The pause is long and highly uncomfortable, especially with Sonic’s offer dangling in the air like a cloud of acrid smoke. When the silver hedgehog does speak, he sounds…annoyed, actually.

“You’re totally serious about this, aren’t you?”

That’s strange; you figured he would be appalled after hearing such a ridiculous offer, and would shoot it down immediately. Instead, it sounds as if he expected this to happen. In spite of the nature of his powers, Silver couldn’t actually read minds. That being the case, why did it sound like he knew this was coming?

Sonic’s forceful voice knocks you out of your train of thought. He pleasantly replies “Yup! I mean, think about it: you didn’t clean up after yourself, so now you get to make up for it by cleaning up after me!”

So…he was serious then. Before you can really digest what that meant, you see Sonic suddenly appear next to Silver. A torrent of wind washes over you with the force of a hurricane in the wake of Sonic’s super-speedy movement. You move slightly on Silver’s tail, but you still keep your balance well enough.

“Come on, man,” Sonic says, in a light and joking voice that teetered very close to the edge of being mocking. “It’s not that big of a deal, right? I mean, with your powers, you don’t even have to touch ‘em.”

Sonic puts his arm around Silver’s back, and begins shaking the white hedgehog as he makes his points. While they may have been playful shoves to someone of Silver’s height, they are violent upheavals to you on his tail. The shakes are so massive that the tip of the extremity whips back and forth in the air, as if Silver was purposefully wagging it. Your butt slides on the smooth fur underneath you as if you were a hockey puck sliding across ice.

How could this be happening? Sonic was really asking for this; he wanted Silver to clean his shoes for him in exchange for the Chaos Emerald. You know Silver was very good to his friends, and would do anything in order to help them. But at this point, Sonic wasn’t worthy of calling Silver his friend. Where Silver was gentle and thoughtful of others, Sonic was brash and self-serving. He was a smarmy little weasel that didn’t deserve the type of kindness that your…well, your lover was capable of.

Silver’s a smart guy. You know he sees this for the farce that it is and will tell Sonic off any second now. When you look up, you can only slightly see the edge of Sonic’s grinning face. It wouldn’t be much, but when Silver shoves him away and tells him to get lost, you should be able to see enough of his expression change to get some satisfaction out of it.

The giant silver teen doesn’t wait long to give his reply. He says, “Okay fine, I’ll do it. Give ‘em to me.”

What the… What on Mobius is going on? Was Silver out of his mind? Why in the world would he belittle himself so much by taking on this ridiculous request? If only you could see his face, maybe it could provide a clue as to what was running through his head. Maybe he was being sarcastic, and he was really telling Sonic to go cop a walk.

You cling desperately to that possibility, but it becomes more and more unlikely as you see Sonic’s titanic face take on a wider smile. He takes a step away from Silver and proceeds to take his sneakers off. After he undoes the golden clasps, he pops one shoe off with the toe of the other, then vice versa.

To your amazement, Sonic’s blue-furred feet emerge when he takes his shoes off. Confusion racks your brain for a time, until the blue titan lifts both sneakers by the puffy white tufts.

Silver’s socks had the very same puff at the ankle. Once you saw them, you’d just assumed that everyone with that similar poof was just wearing those same types of socks. However that didn’t seem to be the case: apparently they were just decorations on the red sneakers, and Sonic really wore his shoes barefoot.

Teal energy surrounds the shoes and they are hoisted into the air by Silver’s powers. As they rise, Sonic says, “Thanks a lot buddy! Take good care of ‘em now, ya hear?”

With that, Sonic’s humongous hand slams into Silver’s back. The friendly pat catches your hero off guard, and he stumbles forward. The heave is so tremendous to your tiny form that you slip off of Silver’s tail and begin plummeting to the ground.

Thinking fast, you try to grab onto Silver’s leg. But the hairs on it are so fine and smooth that you can’t get sufficient purchase. Your next idea is to wrap your body completely around his leg, and slide to a stop as if you were on a fire pole. Unfortunately, your outstretched limbs are not long enough to reach around completely, so you only succeed in grinding your body into Silver’s skin as you plummet.

However, grabbing on like that did have one benefit: you were now perfectly aligned with Silver’s sock puff. You land on it with enough force to knock the wind out of you, and all the excess material completely envelops you.

What you didn’t count on, however, was the springiness of the fabric. It rebounds violently underneath you, and sends you tumbling away from Silver’s foot entirely. You flip end over end two times before landing on your butt. You lean into the landing, rolling like a log three times until you come to a halt on your back.

You feel like you just jumped out of a speeding truck, but at least you were alive. The soreness in your body quickly dissipates when you see where you landed. You were a few normal-sized inches away from Silver’s titanic form, and just opposite the side of him that Sonic was on. With Silver in the way, you couldn’t see the blue hedgehog’s face. Hopefully that meant he hadn’t seen you either.

Silver slowly begins walking away, towards the other side of the room where the bathroom lies. It would be impossible to keep up with him as he walked; every step he took covered the span of two football fields at a time. Instead of running with him, you turn around and move quickly towards the TV stand that was nearby.

You feel fairly safe in the shadow of the stand’s leg. From that position, you can clearly see Sonic look on Silver with an expression of deep satisfaction as the latter makes his way out of the room. Silver, however, isn’t paying much attention to that; he’s instead scanning the floor with every hulking step, apparently looking for something.

He must have felt you fall from his tail and slide down his leg. Now he was looking for you, and being painfully obvious about it.

In fact, Sonic makes a comment. “Hey, Silver you drop something?”

Silver spins on his heels and stands fully upright. His eyes are wide when he says “No…no it’s nothing. Nothing at all.”

To your amazement, Sonic looks genuinely concerned. That’s somewhat of a surprise; since up until now you were certain that he didn’t have a sympathetic bone in his blue body.

He says, “ You sure, dude? I can help you look for it if ya want…”

“NO!” Silver holds his arms out in front of him and starts waving him wildly. He must suddenly realize that doing so makes him look even guiltier, because he abruptly stops and puts them to his sides. He stands as stiffly as if he had been tied up around the waist, and his face glows red with embarrassment.

He says, “I mean…uh…don’t worry about it. It’s fine, really. It’s no big deal. Look, I’ll just get these cleaned up, so don’t go anywhere, okay? I mean not that you would go without your shoes, but…uh, yeah…” He lifts himself off the floor, and with the shoes in tow he hurriedly flies around the corner and out of sight.

Sonic watches with a single cocked eyebrow as Silver leaves the room. When the psychic hedgehog disappears, the blue blur simply shrugs and dismisses the oddness with a casual “whatever.”

The blue titan’s crashing footsteps rock the floor as he walks over to the couch and plops down on it. Wrapping his slender blue toes around the lip of the table, he pushes it with his foot until his leg is completely outstretched. When it is, he crosses his legs underneath him and folds his arms behind his head.

The remote is right next to his butt, but he doesn’t appear interested in watching TV. Instead, he closes his eyes. His chest heaves more and more slowly after a minute, causing you to think that he may have fallen asleep.

Now’s your chance to get the heck out of here. If you run at a decent clip, you should be able to make it to the safe side of the hallway wall in a good minute or so. From there, it should be pretty easy to make your way around and find where Silver was.

Then again…Sonic’s feet did look particularly delectable. Dammit all, you shouldn’t find this jerk attractive, especially after what he’s been doing to your real lover. But your libido doesn’t lie; in spite of Sonic’s actions, he still looks incredibly hot lying there with his feet on full display.

Just a little taste of his feet wouldn’t hurt, right? He’d never know the difference, and you can go find Silver right after. But who knows; maybe if you’re lucky, he’s a heavy sleeper and you can get your rocks off on the cocky bastard’s luscious soles.
13511221122111312121.title: The Price of an Emerald

135112211221113121212.content:
You decide to wait another few minutes to ensure that Sonic was fast asleep. Truth be told, you aren’t totally sure how heavy of a sleeper he actually is; in spite of his sometimes lazy demeanor, he was never actually asleep often in any of the games or comics. In fact, nothing had ever stuck out as explicitly saying he was either heavy or light in his rest.

That’s all the more reason for you to be extra careful, then.

Your heart races as the seconds tick by. He doesn’t budge an inch from his position, save for the slow heaves of his peach-colored belly. His feet are stretched out in front of him, pointing slightly downwards so as to make a 45-degree angle with the floor. You picture being enveloped in the shadows of those massive beauties, taking in Sonic’s unique aroma before touching your lips to his smooth, soft soles…

Damn it. If you keep thinking about it, you’ll probably shoot before you even make it over there.

And no way is that going to happen. The jerk deserved to get his feet dirty after what he did to Silver. Yeah, it’s not really much of a revenge plot, but there’s something about it that just seems right. You were getting off to Sonic’s feet, but not for his amusement; that right was reserved for Silver alone. Instead, you were doing this for your own pleasure, experiencing Sonic’s feet and then leaving when you were done, casting them aside like they were sex toys that served their purpose.

Hey, if Sonic was going to use Silver, than using Sonic like this was the only fair thing to do.

When the beating in your chest becomes unbearable, you finally decide to make your move. You keep on your toes, tiptoeing every step of the way as you close in on Sonic’s feet. Realistically, you could have just run there normally; none of these giants could hear you speak if you screamed at the top of your lungs anyway. The sound of running probably wouldn't reach Sonic’s sleeping ears, but you want to be cautious nonetheless. Better safe then sorry after all, right?

After what seems like an eternity, you finally get within a few steps of the teen hedgehog’s godly soles. You can feel their warmth radiate onto you like the rays of the sun, and their smell coats you as much as your own sweat.

The second you cross into the shade of the blue beauties, your entire field of vision turns blue for a split second. Then it grows dark.

Smooth, firm flesh presses against your entire body while short blue hairs rub against every inch of your exposed skin. Locker-room smell and pleasant moistness overwhelms your senses and makes you dizzy and disorientated. You can’t move, no matter how hard you try.

The only thing you can perceive in your musty prison is the distant, muffled voice of Sonic.

“Gotcha!”

***


Silver the Hedgehog is rinsing off his blue friend’s metallic red shoes and thinking about how much of a steal this situation is for him and his little lover.

Deciding to take up Sonic’s offer was a no-brainer; a measly rinsing of his iconic footwear was a small price to pay for one of the seven most powerful gems in the entire world. Sonic had said so himself, and Silver had to agree with him.

Well, it made sense given the circumstances, anyway. Any other time, Sonic's cocky attitude would have led Silver to throw him into the nearest wall and take the emerald by force. But Silver has more important stuff to worry about now: something that's far more important to him than his pride.

Though it’s really more of a “someone” than a something.

The silver teen never really knew what to expect when he found the speck-sized creature passed out on his living room floor. Honestly, Silver wasn’t quite sure what he was until the little guy explained it to him in his notes. The young hedgehog had never seen anything like him before, and that’s saying a lot considering that Silver had fought a ten-story flame monster for years.

Based on first impressions, the little fella seemed pretty cool. Silver got the feeling that they would hit it off no problem as they hunted for the Chaos Emeralds together. Looking for the mystical gems often made for one hell of a bonding experience. Well, friendships did flourish under times of adversity, right?

In fact, Sonic’s turn from despised Iblis Trigger to a close friend was proof positive of that fact.

In any case, the little guy was immensely grateful for the help. He was certainly grateful enough to give a killer foot massage as a token of appreciation.

Not that Silver had a lot to compare it to. Truth be told, he never really had a foot massage before at all; he just sort of faked a nonchalant attitude when he accepted so as to not sound inexperienced. The reason he never had one was because he never quite understood the appeal. Of course, when the little guy offered, the young hedgehog didn’t want to appear rude by turning the offer down.

Though if Silver was honest with himself, his acceptance wasn’t totally about being polite; deep down, he was extremely curious about it. Was it possible that it was really so good?

In reality, it was even better. Getting a massage was both relaxing and stimulating at the same time; and those feelings spread through his entire body as the tiny guy’s hands gently worked their magic. How any of that was even possible Silver had no idea, but what he did know was that it felt good…really good.

Unfortunately, the good times ended when the little guy passed out after cumming so many times. Even if he hadn’t had such a good time, the young hedgehog still wouldn’t have been mad at the little fella for doing what he did.

Though Silver would be lying if he said he understood it. He only had a very cursory knowledge of fetishes and why they appealed to people. It was…well, it wasn’t something he was particularly keen on researching before now. At any rate, it didn’t matter too much to him; he felt good when he got his feet rubbed and that was that. The little guy enjoying it too was pretty much just icing on the cake. At least, that was the case at first.

The young hedgehog figured that it had to be embarrassing for the little guy to get caught with his pants down, literally. But Silver never would have expected to get the reaction that he did when he confronted the little fella on it. The poor thing broke down instantly, and admitted to everything without protest. Besides feeling sorry for him, Silver kind of respected him a bit too. The guy could have easily tried to lie his way out of it, or to make up some excuse or something in order to save face. But he didn’t do that at all…

Silver was captivated. All that night and all the following morning, he couldn’t stop thinking about the little guy. And it was more than just worrying about his safety, too; he wondered about stupid things, like what his opinion would be of this or that, or what he did in his spare time back home.

The teen hedgehog even wondered what the little guy thought of him, too.

He had no idea what brought this train of thought on, but he couldn’t help it. The more and more he thought about him, the more and more he wanted to be with the little guy. Just having him close by was…comforting, in some weird way. A million different thoughts and feelings raced through the teen's head all morning... and distracted him from the fact that the object of his desires had stowed away inside his footwear.

No matter how much time passes, Silver figures he'll never get over the horror he felt when he stared inside his boot and saw the little guy in there. As Silver pulled him out and looked into his beaten face, his mind couldn’t help but flash images of the cute, tear-filled smile the little guy had given him the night before. It was like he was being taunted, shown a moment of pure joy just at the moment where it was about to be wretched away forever. And it was all Silver’s fault.

But then something truly amazing happened. The little guy, against all rationality, forgave Silver for what he had done. When he crawled up onto Silver’s chest puff and drifted off into a peaceful sleep, the teen hedgehog knew that he hadn’t lost this little guy’s faith at all. And it had nothing to do with the tiny boy being a forgiving person, either.

The little guy loved Silver, more than anything else in the world. And by watching the little fella peacefully slumber amid the soft white fibers, Silver’s chaotic thoughts about everything coalesced into one, solid truth.

Silver had loved the little guy too.

The teen turns off the water, scrutinizing Sonic’s shoes for any dirt he may have missed. He figures that the sooner he finished up with this ridiculous task, the sooner he could look for his little lover in peace. When he's satisfied at seeing his distorted reflection staring back at him in the metal clasp, he shakes the shoes dry in the sink. With a relieved smile, he levitates out the door and down the hallway.

He rounds the bend and stops dead in his tracks.

Sonic is sitting on his couch, grinding something into the floor with his feet. When he turns to Silver and pulls away, the white teen sees his little lover; a panting, sweaty mess with his clothes twisted and wrinkled around his body.

Both of them looked just as shocked to see Silver and he was to see them.
135112211221113121212.title: A New Perspective

choices: "Awesome! So, how about we put your...skills to good use on my feet!"
"Sweet! Come up here, I want to you do something for me."
Use Sonic's momentary distraction to try and escape!
1351122112211131212121.content:
Some time earlier...

The blood drains from your face almost instantaneously and your body begins to feebly quake in horror. He…he was awake? How could that be; you were certain he was out cold. How could he have woken up so quickly?

The blue wall of skin lifts off of you, and for a moment you stare into a pair of curious green eyes. Sonic has his legs spread on either side of you, sitting on the edge of the couch and leaning over you to inspect your puny body from on high.

Seeing his emerald green eyes stare directly into yours sends a chill through your body that could have easily frozen your blood. In spite of the futility, you want to heed your gut reaction and run, very quickly and very far away. Though when you try to move your arms and legs, your muscles rebel against you by remaining perfectly rigid. Your breathing becomes shallower, and you start to feel dizzy. Your mind begins to repeat a singe question over and over, as if mentally chanting it will somehow magically whisk you out of this nightmare; what am I going to do now?

Sonic lets out an impressed whistle that pierces your eardrums. You wince at the pain, and by the time your eyes open again, he is bent down over you, clamping the back collar of your shirt between his bus-sized fingers.

He yanks you up off the floor at a nausea-inducing speed. Reflex takes over; your hands fly up to the front collar of your shirt, your fingers hook in-between your neck and the cotton-wrapped elastic, and you pull down with all your strength to fight the tugging force of the giant hedgehog at your back. It’s a good thing your reflexes were as good as they are, as even a moment’s more hesitation could have resulted in you being inadvertently hung by the big blue teen.

In your intense anger you begin flailing your legs, trying against all hope to kick the bastard to make him let you go. You even scream at the top of your lungs for him to put you down, but even as the words explode out of your mouth, you know it’s all just a waste of breath. Sonic didn’t hear you; the fact that he showed no change in his expression of curiosity was a testament to that.

All the kicking stops when Sonic finally opens his big mouth. His voice is so loud that you almost throw your hands up to your ears, at the expense of leaving your neck exposed.

“Hey there, little guy. I’ll be honest; this is kind of a surprise. I knew Silver was hiding something, but I didn’t think it’d be a little fella like you.”

He spreads his other hand out underneath you and lets go of your collar. After falling for a second, you land awkwardly on a plush cushion of fabric-coated skin. You aren’t hurt from the impact, but you do have to sit up in order to lock gazes with Sonic again.

“Ya know, I got a lot of questions for you. But honestly, I think the one I’m most curious about is why you were sneaking around my feet while I was relaxing.” You don’t answer him, not that you could if you wanted to. Instead you sit there leering at him, in the hopes that he got the message that you didn’t want anything to do with him. But it doesn’t look like Sonic was studying you for an answer; instead it appears that he’s thinking and trying to deduce the answer himself.

His epiphany comes a few moments later. “Ohhh…you like them, don’t you?”

A pit forms in the base of your stomach. How could he have figured that out? You hadn’t done anything yet; there should be no way that he could have guessed about your foot fetish. Was it possible that he was the psychic hedgehog here?

You then have an epiphany of your own. You weren’t dealing with naive and oblivious little Silver here anymore; Sonic had way more experience under his belt than the silver teen, and it went way beyond just beating up robots and saving little woodland creatures. The very act of running around at supersonic speeds would require an insane level of perceptibility and intuition on his part. You suspect that the blue giant had to be abundant with both in order to be sitting in front of you right now: if he didn’t, well, he probably would’ve splattered into a tree or rock a long time ago.

That being the case, it’s no wonder why he's catching onto you and Silver so quickly. He probably had an idea something strange was afoot the moment Silver told his first lie. From there, all he had to do was play along until he had a chance to investigate. And you, being the veritable brain trust that you were, went right up to him and handed him that opportunity on a silver platter.

You are broken out of your trance by Sonic speaking to you again. To your surprise, it seems to be a question directed squarely at you, and you notice Sonic’s face loom large as he eagerly awaits your answer.

“So, was I right? Do you really like ‘em, little guy?”

You don’t really know what to say. In a way, you feel like he already knows the answer, or at the very least suspects it. You don’t think lying to him will work, as he’d probably call you out on it immediately. Quite frankly, you really don’t even want to think about what he’d do to you after that.

Though what’s the alternative; you tell him the truth and he has his way with you? Would that even happen, realistically? With Sonic, it’s all a flip of the coin, and with your life hanging in the balance, you aren’t terribly fond of those odds.

You decide to wait a moment to gauge his reaction, in the hopes that you could uncover more of what he was getting at. He is looking at you intently, as if studying your every movement and facial expression for a hint of an answer. But at the same time, he appears patient; a decidedly odd look on the infamously impulsive hedgehog. What on Mobius is he trying to get at? Finally, you decide to give in and nod your head in affirmation. Your logic is that you’d much rather deal with him when he’s pleased than risk him getting pissed off when you lied.

Unsurprisingly, he seems satisfied with this. A toothy grin creeps across one half of his massive face, while his eyelids drape halfway down his eyes. The condescending look is both infuriating and terrifying.

“Heh, I knew it. Can’t say I blame ya, though…they are some kinda beauties, aren’t they?” You feel the ground upend as Sonic shifts his weight backwards to lift his feet into the air. He wiggles his toes in front of himself, devilishly taunting you with their presence while keeping them far out of your reach. At the sight of his toes wagging in mid air, you feel your little head jerk upward. Curses; even when he was teasing you, you still found it hot.

“Anyway, you and Silver are pretty tight buds I guess, huh?” You must have looked stunned by his wildly correct guess, and Sonic must have decided to actually acknowledge it this time, because he goes on to explain.

“Well, I know that the whole feast he put together wasn’t for Blaze; I mean, besides the fact that it was an obvious lie, Silver’s way too shy to put on all this and get all romantic and stuff with somebody.” You chuckle a bit in the back of your mind, though you don’t dare to let the expression show on your face. Apparently he didn’t know his “buddy” Silver as well as he thought he did.

“Which,” he says, “can only mean he had a new friend over, and wanted to impress ‘em with his cooking skills. Oh, let me guess, he cooked everything at the same time with his powers, didn’t he? Heh, classic.” His smugness seems to wrap around him like the luxurious mink sweater of a snotty, upper-class heiress. And it doesn’t help that, though the details were way off, he was totally right in his conclusions. He successfully tore down the veneer Silver had carefully tried to construct in order to protect you, and now that you were here in his palm, the truth was laid bare for all to see. You think bitterly that if you hadn’t slinked from your hiding spot and came over here, even with the tremendous amount of suspicions he had, Sonic would have left the house being none the wiser to the entire ploy.

But you just had to go after those feet, didn’t you?

Sonic says, “Well, since you two are such good buddies, maybe you’ll want to help him out in fulfilling his payment to me.” The ground beneath you quakes as Sonic suddenly rises to a standing position. It’s so quick that you fall over in his hand, your stomach feeling like it’s racing to catch up and causing you to feel nauseous. Your disorientation worsens when you hear a loud, sickening screech come from below you. Before you can clear your mind enough to figure out what it was, you are dumped unceremoniously on the hard surface of the coffee table.

That sound must have been Sonic moving the table closer to the couch, since his knees almost make contact with the table’s edge when he sits down.

He goes on to say, “Now, no pressure for you to do anything, little fella. It’s Silver’s fault he’s in this mess to begin with, so no worries if he has to clean it up himself. That said, I’ll betcha he’d be really appreciative if you helped him get outta this hole. Heck, I know I would!”

Wait a minute, was Sonic being serious right now? Was he really planning on stringing Silver along even longer for that damned emerald? This was going way too far, and you had no more patience left for the blue titan. The sooner he was out of Silver’s hair, and out of your life, the better.

And now, for the first time since you arrived on Mobius, you have the power to do something about it. If you agreed to Sonic’s demands, whatever they might be, you could help Silver tremendously. You'd be sacrificing your dignity for that of your white hero, and thus freeing him from Sonic's unreasonable clutches.

For Silver, it's a price you’d be willing to pay a thousand times over. Without regret or hesitation, you nod your head yes.
1351122112211131212121.title: A Tiny's Gotta Do What a Tiny's Gotta Do.

choices: Silver rounds the corner and sees what has happened.
Sonic keeps grinding you into the table, without Silver anywhere in sight.
You hear a voice in the distance...and it's not Silver OR Sonic
13511221122111312121211.content:
“Aw man, this is awesome!”

Sonic practically shouts as you agree to his terms, though it probably only sounded that way due to your diminutive size. Either way, he was certainly excited; his cocky grin had grown to a full-blown smile, and his cheeks rose so high that his eyes looked squeezed shut. When he opened them again, they sparkled like polished, human-sized emeralds. The twinkling causes your stomach to tie itself in knots; you have no doubt that his mesmerized look is a bad omen, and only signals that he’s thinking hard about which humiliating labor to put you through.

The giant blue teen crosses one leg over the other, resting his elbow on his knee and likewise resting his chin on his fist. His gigantic eyes scan over you, but he doesn’t open his mouth to speak. You don’t sit down and you don’t shift your gaze from him; you don’t even shuffle in place, even though your nerves compel you to do so. You stand tall in the face of the coming danger, just as your silver hero would have done.

Giant and tiny lock eyes for what seems like hours. Movement in the corner of your eye forces you to break your gaze; though you don’t lose the intensity in your stare, nor do you move a muscle other than your eyes. The toes of Sonic’s suspended foot wiggle mockingly a few yards away. Upon looking at his feet, an involuntary shiver of pleasure courses through your body, rippling through every part of it before culminating in your dick. It pulses in tandem with the waves, filling up with your blood and growing more and more erect.

You feel your face grow warm with a blush, and then dissipate the instant you realized it was happening. You look back at Sonic, but it was too late. His building-sized mouth perks up at the corners, and his eyelids slide down to cover the tops of his pupils. He doesn’t move otherwise (even his toes had stopped moving now), and for the longest time his chips away at your brave façade with his impish stare. You do your best to at least hold the intensity of your glare, but even that you can feel weakening as you look at his titanic, conniving face.

Finally, he relieves your squirming by speaking. You’re almost thankful for it; that is, until you comprehend what he says.

“I know what to do with you. You want these babies so badly; “ he tilts his head towards his suspended foot, “then maybe I’ll just let you have ‘em.” He reaches across the enormous distance between the couch and where you stand, coiling his fingers around your body in a tight grip up to your neck and whisking you up in front of his face. His grasp is so tight that deep breathing becomes impossible.

You are even with his monolithic black nose when he says “Okay, here’s the deal, little guy; if you give me a foot massage, I’ll consider Silver and me even and give him the Chaos Emerald.” He brings his other hand into view, pointing a vehicle-sized finger at your tiny head.

“Now, you have to do it for as long as I say; otherwise it doesn’t count. If you can’t do it or you stop before I tell you, then Silver still owes me one. That’ll sure suck for him, but that’s not really your problem either.“ He shrugs, eyebrows raised and eyes closed as he does it.

When his eyes open again, they stare at you intensely. All the cockiness in his face had vanished in an instant, and was replaced by a warning steadiness. He says, “I just wanna make sure your still up for this. No shame in backing out now if you’re not interested.” All of a sudden, there’s a shadow of a smirk; “not that I think you don’t want this.”
