You puff out your chest dramatically and beat it with a strong, open hand, indicating that you can take care of yourself without the help of nanny Silver.

“Oh yeah, I bet you’re a real tough guy,” the teen says, as he raises himself up to his full height. He crosses his arm in front of his chest and raises an eyebrow as he says; “tell me again how that worked out for ya when you were being ground into dust by Sonic’s big toe. Or are you gonna tell me that that was ‘all part of your plan,’ or something stupid like that?”

Your face flushes red at the dismantling of your argument. But that didn’t change the fact that you weren’t in any danger; you skillfully kept Sonic in a good mood and avoided anything that would have pissed him off. You knew exactly what you were doing, even if it didn’t look that way to an outsider.

Before you can offer your retort, Silver huffs through his nose and turns back towards the sink. He then closes his eyes and takes a deep breath; when he speaks again, his voice is far calmer, but not at the expense of it’s commandingly hard edge.

“I’ll be making us lunch in a few minutes. Go someplace where you won’t get into any more trouble, all right? I’ll call you when it’s done.”

That seemed to be the end of the conversation. It caught you so off guard that you weren’t sure what you wanted to do next. You have more to say, WAY more, but Silver seems insistent that he isn’t interested in hearing it right now. Perhaps it would be better if you slinked off somewhere and cooled down for a minute or two. If you did that, then maybe you could come up with a solution that would benefit you both, and bring about an end to this gross misunderstanding.

But then you catch a glimpse at the small piece of plate from before. Throwing the thing at him seemed oddly satisfying, and it would show him that you couldn’t be shoved off into a corner somewhere like some disobedient child. You have a point to make, and you were dead set on making it to your pig-headed protector. Too bad if he didn't want to hear it; you know for certain that once he DID, he'd see the error of his ways. After that...well, maybe a session or two of make-up sex would be in order, with YOU calling all the shots.
13511221122111312121211212.title: The Rift Slowly Opens

choices: Come up with a plan to get on Silver's nerves...right now.
135112211221113121212112121.content:
This misunderstanding has to end as quickly as possible. You march over to the tiny piece of plate, thoroughly intent on using it as often as you had to until you got your point across. Ignoring the problem like Silver wanted was only going to lead to more animosity, and even though you didn’t want to admit it, you knew that it hurt to see this rift form between you two. Rage may have guided your actions before, but the fuel burning that flame was one of a profound desperation; a deep, DEEP desire to get things back to the way they were.

You heft the ball of ceramic and hurl it at Silver’s massive leg with all your strength. It impacts noiselessly and bounces away in some random direction, but Silver’s hiss of pain through angrily clenched teeth tells you that the hit was very much effective. He growls bitterly before addressing you.

“You really can’t listen to me ONCE can you? Why can’t you just leave me alone?”

You shake your head emphatically, and then make the scribbling motion on your open palm again. Though a slight fear forms at the bottom of your stomach, (no doubt a result of seeing a powerful, gigantic teenager get increasingly annoyed at your constant meddling), you soldier on with your request regardless. Getting this mess sorted out was far more important than any apprehension you could possibly feel.

Silver rolled his eyes and turned off the running faucet. And instant later he glows teal and lifts you up into the air with his mental powers. You notice that the take off was abrupt; vastly different from the gentle and graceful levitations he had performed on you in the past.

Your giant protector wears an annoyed scowl as he floats all the way across the room towards the sofa. His tight grip on you prevents you from moving your head, but out of the corner of your eye you see him levitate the graphite and pad of paper that you had used to communicate before.

Silver drops himself onto the couch with an inconspicuously loud THOOM, right before placing you and your stationary down on the coffee table in front of him. While you get your bearings on the wooden surface, he crosses one leg over the other, folds his arms in front of his chest poof and sighs impatiently.

As you expected, the process of writing everything out is painfully slow and physically exhausting; however, your drive to clear the air with your hedgehog crush pushed you along. Once five minutes of steady writing passes, you reach the end of the page and have to flip to a new one. You toss your graphite aside for a moment so that you could pull the paper with both hands; a smart move, considering you need almost all your strength in order to peel back the driveway-sized sheet from all the rest.

While you’re turning your page, you hazard a glace up at Silver. He has his cheek resting on his fist, and his eyes restlessly dart around in the general area of the door. He looks like he’s doing everything he can to avoid looking at you and what you’re writing. At first this strikes you as an insult to your labors, as if he really DIDN’T give a damn about what you had to say. However, the more rational part of your brain consoled you with the thought that he was simply looking away to avoid reading what you've written before you had a chance to finish. It’s enough to quell the torrent of anger that swelled in you as a result, but the fact that Silver’s eyebrows seemed permanently fixed in their furrowed position didn’t instill you with a terrific amount of confidence in your rationale.

Your conflicted feelings only serve to increase your level of fatigue. Ten minutes of steady writing passes, then twenty. The words pour out of you much more sluggishly as your mind and body slowly burn out. You want to keep going, to finish what you started quickly, but your exhaustion prevents it. Deciding to take a quick break, you step off the paper and collapse on the dark wood coffee table.

After smacking your tongue on the roof of your parched mouth, you come to realize that you hadn’t had anything to drink since before the incident with Sonic. With you finally sitting down, your body screams at you to get something to drink. You see that Silver is still looking away from you, but you decide to wave him down to get his attention anyway.

His mind is clearly elsewhere; again, you weren’t sure if that was due to malice against you or simple absentmindedness, and trying to figure it out puts more strain on you than you care to handle. The feeling of the piece of graphite in your hand gives you an idea. Without even bothering to aim, you chuck the pencil tip in the general direction of your titanic host, using the last of your strength to ensure that it impacted with sufficient force. When it plinks off his skin just underneath the left side of his chest hair, you hear him gasp sharply in surprise. Before he turns to look at you, he closes his eyes and takes a deep breath through his nose, then lets it out through his teeth.

“I really wish you’d quit throwing stuff at me.” He says under his breath as he gives you a fleeting look. Under normal circumstances, you’d retort that there was no other foreseeable way for you to get his attention, but the thought is promptly scrubbed away by a riptide of drowsiness. You sign to him a drinking motion, but he looks away before you can get the invisible cup to your lips.

Rather, your white-furred guardian’s gaze lands on your work in progress. Before you can do anything about it, he leans over and reaches for the pad lying next to you. A lightning bolt of anxiety careens through your entire body, defibrillating your tired mind and banishing all traces of fatigue. Before you know it, you’re on your feet, yelling up to him that you weren’t done with your story yet.

Naturally, however, Silver doesn’t hear your pleas. He swipes the pad up off the table so fast that a gust of air billows over you. With your newfound energy, you jump up and down and scream at the top of your lungs, but nothing diverts his attention from what you had written. In your excitement, the thought of you being slighted on purpose seems more and more like a real possibility. Anger begins to flare up in you, and as your progressively louder cries continue to go unanswered, the idea manifests to find something else to throw at him.

You look around feverishly, but the only projectile you had was now somewhere on the floor below you. But your search abruptly ends when you see your pad drop within inches of your tiny form, landing on the table with a deafening THOOM.

“There; now that you got all that off your chest, do you feel better now?” Silver didn’t look any less annoyed as you gazed up at him from the table’s surface. Your heart swan dives into the pit of your stomach when a sickening implication comes to mind; the thought that he hadn’t read a single word of what you said stabs you in the gut so hard that you begin to absentmindedly pant to catch your breath again.

The crashing of his booted feet might as well have been the sound of your whole world crashing down around you. You’re too stunned for words, but you can still perceive enough of what was going on around you to hear Silver say,

“Like I said before, I got lunch to make.” It doesn’t register when he picks you up with his powers and deposits you on the couch; you only realize it later when your find yourself sunken into the supple couch cushion after you were already moved.

Without another word, he plods back off to the kitchen. You find that you only have the willpower to watch on as he works hundreds of feet away from you, back turned and intensely focused on finishing his task. He doesn’t look back at you once; not even a glance in your general direction is afforded to you.

With the sound of each pot and pan being placed on the countertop next to him, more and more of your feelings become detangled as the shock wears off. You gave it your all, but it still wasn’t enough. Perhaps Silver would stay mad at you forever; and if that was the case, then what could you possibly do about it? You wanted to be sad about it…to cry your eyes out at the loss of a beautiful relationship right on the eve of its consummation. But if Silver was going to treat you like this, like a little kid that didn’t know any better and had to be constantly coddled, then spending your tears on him seemed… like a waste. He didn’t seem too upset about losing you, after all; so it was reasonably clear to you that you shouldn’t feel so bad about it either. You clearly deserved better than Silver, someone who didn’t fly off the handle at the tiniest transgression, and one who actually LISTENED to you when you were trying to explain yourself.

But you were stuck with him: for now, anyway. Surely, though, you shouldn’t be subjected to this kind of treatment from him. You may be miniscule to him, but you had rights just as much as anyone else; a fact that he seemed to forget when he couldn’t even show you the slightest bit of common courtesy by letting you continue with your account. Well then, you figure that if he was going to treat you like a child, than perhaps you should act like one…the most obstinate, reckless, pain-in-the-ass disobedient little kid that you could possibly be. If you absolutely HAD to be stuck with him for the foreseeable future, then you had to be sure that you would make it the most stressful time Silver had ever had in his entire life. It was only fair thing to do, after all.
135112211221113121212112121.title: Without a Silver Lining

choices: Silver returns...and has something to tell you
Silver returns...and sits down on the couch next to you.
1351122112211131212121121211.content:
The days following your fight with Silver quickly began to follow a distinct pattern. You wasted no time in giving the teenaged hedgehog a headache every chance you could, and you ensured that his torture went on for every waking moment. Of course, he didn’t take that lying down, and so each day became a teeter-totter of who got one over on whom, and who was embittered because of what. This struggle between hard headed titan and tiny carried on for days, and then weeks. Soon, your prickly attitude and the actions resulting from it became like a daily routine, as natural to you as waking up in the morning and brushing your teeth.

This morning you were on Silver’s dresser, just underneath the television in his room. Initially, your giant protector let you sleep on the end table directly next to his bed; but he soon realized that, while this WAS close enough for him to keep a close eye on you, it was TOO close for him to do anything productive; like sleep, for example. And so, the little sleeping bag that he made for you out of one of his old socks (one that he THORUOGHLY cleaned, much to your chagrin) was moved over to his dresser, right where he thought you couldn’t be a bother to him.

Once you fully awaken, you walk over to the very edge of the dresser and, without a second’s hesitation; leap off to the floor below. The impact barely sends a shiver up your spine, as the incredibly thick carpet cushions your fall, just as intended. In time, you wade through the carpet and arrive at the base of Silver’s bed. Once there, you reach around the leg of the footboard and produce a carefully hidden thread. To you, this thread was about as thick as rope, extending from the bottom of Silver’s mattress and bridging the empty space between his box-spring and the floor. You give it a tug to ensure that it’s secured tightly, and once you’re certain it is, you begin climbing.

Soon, you crawl out onto the vast, white plain of bed sheets and comforters. In the distance, you see part of the titan's fur sticking out from a huge bulge in the sheets. His face isn't visible at this distance, but you know exactly what you’ll find once you get closer. Sure enough, when you close the distance, you see that he’s sleeping peacefully in his normal position: on his side, with everything from his shoulders up peeking out from under his sheets. The rest of his titanic body is covered in a thick layer of warm blankets; his cute, relaxed looks simply angelic as he gently snoozes under your feet.

A smirk forms as you look over at the nearby clock; you see that it’s exactly six in the morning, and your heart leaps in anticipation.

You casually walk over to the exposed section of Silver’s shoulder, taking your time to imagine how comfy he must be at the moment. When you feel Silver’s fur tickling the bottoms of your feet, you check your balance to ensure that you wouldn’t be sent plummeting to the mattress below. The instant you feel secure, you bend at your knees and jump as high as you can into the air. After you reach your apex, you bring your heels together and extend your legs so that you come down like a heavy needle onto Silver’s exposed skin. The impact pushes your heels so far into the giant’s arm that you could swear you hit bone. You use the downward momentum to wind up your next jump; then you do it again, and again, and again.

You keep an eye on Silver’s face the entire time, eager to see it contort in misery as he's rudely awakened at such an early hour. But as you begin to lose count of how many times you slammed into him, you notice that such a thing isn’t going to happen. He HAD woken up, of that you were certain; his peaceful breathing had ceased and his relaxed face grew far more alert, though his eyes remained closed and he didn’t move a muscle.

Of course he wouldn’t give you the reaction that you wanted, as that was just one of the many ways he punished you for being so obnoxious. But this doesn’t dissuade you; if there was one thing you learned during your month in Mobius, it was how to push Silver’s buttons. You stop jumping and take a few steps towards his upper shoulder. Here, the thick hairs of his chest poof extend up and around his shoulder, towards his back. With a cursory glance in the direction of his face, you reach down and yank a hair right out of the ground, as if it were a weed in a garden.

That gets his attention. His yelp is ear-gratingly loud, but short and satisfying. You're so smug that you don’t even mind when his massive hand reaches out from underneath the covers and yanks you off of his shoulder. He jerks you in front of his face, and the sight just makes you even more devilishly happy; you can't help but show amusement as you see his groggy face do it’s best impression of severe annoyance. However, since he just woke up, the most he can manage is to furrow his brow and he lazily blinks at you; all the while sighing angrily through his nose.

When his eyes finally open wide enough to look at you, he speaks in a voice that sounded like he'd just gargled with gravel. He says, “Aw, come on…how’d you get over here? I thought I put you across the room.” He pauses a moment, like he’s about to turn around and confirm where your sleeping quarters were, but seeing as he was still in the process of waking up, he probably didn’t feel like moving just yet.

In fact, he doesn’t say anything further for a few minutes; instead, he gathers his strength, and finally sits up after a few minutes of preparation. Once there, he twists and contorts his upper body in a variety of stretching motions, with you still firmly held in his grasp. The movements of his hands are quick and sweeping, and you're twisted and turned in a variety of orientations before he's through. Like a nauseating carnival ride, you swing and jerk through the air; a terrifying experience when you notice that you're dozens of feet in the air. You try your best not to scream in terror, as you know that that's just the reaction he'd be hoping to get. Instead, you try squeezing your eyes shut, but that only amplifies the feeling of vertigo you experience while being swung about.

When the ordeal finally ends, Silver places you on his covered lap. He seems very convincingly aloof as he fixes the disheveled white pillars on the top of his head that was his hair. He says, “I think I’m gonna have to put you in a drawer tonight or something. Obviously I can’t trust you with being out in the open on your own.”

You blink up at him innocently, pouting you lips and pressing your hands together in a pleading-like sign. Then, you reach down to your feet and mime putting a sock onto your right foot.

“Oh yeah, you’d like it if I put you in my SOCK drawer… well then, I guess I'll just stick you in a junk drawer somewhere.” He glances down at you and smirks while he says, “Ya know, when I think about it, the junk drawer seems like a pretty fitting place to put you. I’d probably have a lot less headaches if I just kept you in there.”

Your heart stops a tick when you hear Silver say that. You try your best not to let it get to you, and you think that you put on a fairly good show of not looking bothered by what he says, but the look on your belligerent teenaged caretaker's face tells you that your façade isn’t so airtight.

Turning away from him seems like the best course of action, since he then couldn’t read your facial expressions. But that's all the reaction he needs, and you hear him chuckle softly to himself. The ground beneath you upheaves, and you see Silver swing his legs over the side of the bed and plant them on the floor below. Before you know it, he lifts you up with his powers; floating himself up off the bed as soon as you made it into the air. You both refrain from saying anything further as you both hover out of the room and towards the kitchen.

The morning continued according its usual course. The days where Silver prepared you a lavish meal were long past; instead, he fed you whatever he happened to be making and eating himself that day. This morning's meal was oatmeal, dressed with a combination of cinnamon and sugar. Along with your own bowl of soupy oat mash, your gigantic host also provides you with small amounts of condiments on the side so that you can season your breakfast to your liking.

No one makes conversation during the meal, as per usual. The only time Silver speaks to you is after you are both done eating, when he informs you that he's going out to hunt for the Chaos Emeralds...again. You barely pay it any mind, and instead prepare your body for what you know comes next; like clockwork, Silver lifts you up with his psychokinesis and places you in your usual spot on the coffee table in the living room. The usual three bowls soon follow, the same blue and white ones you used during your first night. Finally, as he levitates his shoes on his feet, he flicks the TV on and places the remote next to you; a gesture that's unnecessary, since you have no plans on changing the channel while he's gone.

His young eyes seem to glitter with satisfaction as you glare up at him; you have no doubt that he’s content with the fact that he's set you up with everything you'll need. But to you, the treatment's humiliating; like a dog being prepared for an extended period without his master. With smile on his face, Silver turns towards the door; he says his goodbyes from over his shoulder right before closing the door behind him. Just like every other day, you're left alone to your own devices. You probably won’t move from the spot where your sitting, as you just don't see the point in moving when you have nowhere to go.
1351122112211131212121121211.title: The Daily Grind

choices: Wave him on and wait. The sooner he leaves, the sooner you'll see his present
13511221122111312121211212111.content:
Much to your surprise, Silver isn’t gone for very long. Only about two programs play through their entirety on the TV when you hear the distinctive, ear-splitting creak of the door opening off to your right. It comes as such shock that you actually stand up and turn to watch him enter; looking on as the cool air of Mobius’s autumn blows in with him. The warmness of his smile is almost enough to warm your cold heart towards him, but the brisk breeze that filtered into the house behind him woke you from the fantasy before you could indulge in it too much.

Without turning around, he kicks the door closed with the heel of his boot, making it slam home with a thunderous crash. He didn’t close it normally because he was so focused on staring at you; he locked his giant golden irises with yours as soon as he entered, and didn’t break the gaze until he slid to a kneeling position right next to the table.

You eye him up and down for a second, trying to discern what got him so excited. It wasn’t unusual for Silver to be out on his gallivants for hours on end; most times he wouldn’t arrive back home until well into the evening, when the sunlight was replaced with moonlight and it became too difficult to search any further. What could he have done in such a short time that would cause him to return so soon?

Unless…

Your eyes begin to glow with excitement, and your face stretches into an incredibly wide and toothy smile. This causes Silver to respond in kind; the ginormous enamel formations that were his teeth peeked in from the edges of his mouth as a smile grew and exposed them. He even giggled a little under his breath, which made you even more excited. However, even though he was smiling at you, he didn’t open his mouth to say anything.

You raise your eyebrows and nod a little, urging him on to say the words that you couldn’t wait to hear. However, instead of saying something, his smile drops and his brow furrow. His eyes scan you wordlessly for a moment, before realizing something and marking his newfound comprehension with a long “Oh.”

He shakes his head from side to side and says “No, I didn’t find the Emerald today. Sorry about that.”

Your smile turns to a scowl in no time flat. Now thoroughly disinterested in whatever he WAS smiling about, you turn towards the TV with an angry sigh and sit back down in your spot; bringing your knees back up to your chest and hugging your shins as if it would make Silver disappear from your sight.

Of course, it doesn’t; and Silver doesn’t appear to notice your displeasure, as he begins to go off on his rant anyway. He excitedly recites everything that happened after he left the house: something about Eggman attacking a nearby town and the intense battle that followed. You did your best to pay attention to the program that was playing in front of you; it may have been a rerun of a show you’ve seen many times already, but you still get annoyed that you can’t hear EXACTLY what’s being said over the sound of Silver’s ramblings.

Finally fed up with hearing his droning on in the background after a moment or two, you decide to make your sour disposition known by getting up and stomping over to the TV remote. In order to do so, you have to turn and face where Silver was kneeling, but luckily you don’t make eye contact. He was casually going on with his story while looking upwards quizzically, as if he was reading a transcription of the account that was written on the ceiling. You roll your eyes and mash the volume up bottom with your heel, all the way until the sound of the television droned out Silver’s blabbering.

The increase in volume caught Silver’s attention; he looked back down at you and then at the TV. You hear him tsk in in disgust as you walk back to your seat, but you never make it there. Silver snatches you up off the table mid-step, flinging you up in the air under the grip of his massive hand so quickly that the room begins to spin. You blink off the vertigo just in time to see Silver’s ticked off face glare down at you.

“Well fine, doesn’t matter if you want to hear about it anyway. The point is, I need to borrow you for a sec.” Without even asking your permission, he bounds across the room with you in tow. Just when you think you’ll see your breakfast on the outside of your belly again, he stops and lets you down onto yet another hard surface. You rub your eyes to stop the swirling shapes from taking over your vision; when things finally become clear, you notice Silver rummaging through a drawer in front of you.

You take the opportunity to regain your bearings; instantly you realize that you are standing the surface of the desk on the far side of Silver’s living room. This was the very desk that your stationary was housed; and while you have made your way over here at floor level on occasion, you’ve never had the opportunity to stand on its surface like this. The area surrounding you was barren of all objects, save for a small cup containing a myriad of writing implements.

In another few moments, the sound of Silver’s rummaging ceases, replaced by an “ah ha!” of confirmation. You turn and watch as your titanic guardian produces a long, thin piece of wood from out of a small side drawer. The ruler, which you assumed was a foot long to Silver, as he used imperial units all the time, stretched up to many times your height and was easily about as thick as the height of your head.

Before he placed the ruler down, Silver poked and prodded at various points on your body. Apparently he was adjusting you, as when you finally ended up standing straight and tall, he lined the ruler up with your body. He squints one eye shut as he measures you, using his hand to determine where the top of your head ended up. In the back of your mind, you somewhat wish that you had listened to his story before; perhaps there was a hint in it that would make things clearer as to what the heck he was doing with you. After he measures you height wise, he turns the ruler sideways and attempts to measure your width.

You bear the humiliation of being sized up like a children’s doll for as long as it takes for Silver to get his measurements. Once he’s turned the ruler around you for the umpteenth time, he finally places it down and prances back into the living room. He kneels down at the coffee table and scribbles something on the notepad that you’d left there, ripping the page off of the pad when he’s done, and stuffing it into the space between his skin and his golden arm brace.

Before he notices you signing the question of just what the heck he was doing, he snatches you up and places you back down on the surface of the coffee table again. When the new wave of dizziness wears off, you hear Silver say, “Okay, that’s all I needed, thanks little guy. I’m gonna go now, but I’ll be back soon.” He smiles broadly and then says “Next time you see me, I’ll have a present for you. And before you ask, no…it won’t be an Emerald; at least I don’t plan on it.”

At another time, you may have actually been excited about this mysterious present of his; but ever since the fight, you’ve learned to become weary of any time that Silver makes plans for you. More often then not, they end in your abject humiliation and him feeling smug and confident the entire day. Not interested in letting that happen, you shrug your shoulders and then point at him, trying to ask just what the hell he was talking about.

Silver’s massive lips pout in response. “If you’d let me finish my story, maybe you’d know what I had in mind. But since you don’t care, you can find out later.” Then, he crosses his arms in front of him, “before I go, are there anything else you’ll need? I don’t want to come back here and see you all moody because you thought I ignored you or something.”
13511221122111312121211212111.title: Collecting Useful Data

135112211221113121212112121112.content:
Initially, you were going to tell him that you were fine, but then you get another idea. You press your hands together and rest your cheek on them.

“You want your sleeping bag?” Silver asks, and you nod an affirmative. Without saying anything else, he hovers out of the room and out of sight. The moment he rounds the corner, you sprint for your restroom bowls. When you reach the full blue bowl, you cup your hands together and scoop out as much water as you can carry; then you rush over to the empty bowl and toss the liquid into it. As the water forms a bead at the bottom of the basin, you hurry back to repeat the process. Once four or five handfuls of water pool at the bottom of the empty bowl, you wipe your hands on your pants and move back towards your original position.

At that very instant Silver returns with your sleeping sock. He places it in front of you, and you make a show of climbing in. Right before you pull the lip of the sock over your head, however, you point towards the empty bowl, which now holds a thin layer of liquid at the bottom of its basin. You see Silver glance over at it, and then roll his eyes before picking it up and taking it into the bathroom. It appears that he wasn’t too fond of cleaning up your “pee” right before he had to leave.

Seizing the opportunity, you crawl out of the sock and run over to the remote control. Luckily for you, it was JUST about as wide as you were, if a little bit taller. However, Silver’s sock is so massive that the clicker would still fit inside easily without him noticing. It’s a bit of a struggle, but you finally heft the device into position inside your bed and close the lip behind it.

With very little time to spare before Silver gets back, you find that you don’t have very many options to get down off the coffee table. Though you never wanted to try it, it appears you had to test your theory about the human body being able to take serious falls when shrunken. You reach the edge of the dark wood piece of furniture and kneel down to hang off of it, so that you were as close to the ground as you could possibly be. When you finally work up the nerve to do it, you let go and plummet to the hard ground below. The impact isn’t as serious as you thought, though you do roll forward on the landing out of instinct. Now that you were on the floor, you had a much better chance of sneaking onto Silver’s person unnoticed.

You hear Silver’s thunderous footsteps before you see him round the bend. You can only see up to his knees when he finally approaches the table, but that’s all you’re really interested in anyway. Knowing full well that this would be your only chance to get on him, you sprint as fast as you can towards the towers of leather and rubber. As you near the aqua-colored toe of Silvers boot, you wind yourself up for a mighty leap that sends you crashing into the solid surface. You land on the very tip of the boot; right was it careens downward to meet the rim of the outsole. While there was nothing jutting out to give you purchase, most of your body landed above the rounded edge, meaning that you didn’t immediately fall off due to your own weight. You clamber up until your whole body is sprawled out on the flat upper part of Silver’s shoe, right where the aqua and dark gray with the white stripe meet.

Then you suddenly feel a shift of the ground underneath you. You are hoisted into the air very briefly before everything is rocked from below you. Silver had only shifted his foot, but even that was enough to get you to lose balance. You know that you have to move somewhere more secure, and when you scan around, you think you find salvation. Right where Silver’s ankle was located there was a collection of folds in the material of the boots. Many of these folds looked big enough not only to grab onto, but also to hide you completely if you lie underneath them.

You make a break for it, silently praying that Silver didn’t take a step before you can make it there. Thankfully, he doesn’t begin to walk until after you slide into a particularly large crevice, wrap it around you and hold on for dear life. It’s rough dealing with his walking at first, as each step rocks you to your core and slides you around in your small pocket of protection. You don’t feel any relief until you hear him say some encouraging words high above your head.

“Okay, I’m heading out now little guy. I’ll see you later.” Once you hear those words, the shaking stops and you notice a distinct aura surround everything nearby. You hold on tighter when you hear the sound of the door shutting, and you feel the cool outside air wash over your body.

You close your eyes in preparation for the inevitable acceleration, but it doesn’t come right away. First, you hear a sigh leave Silver’s lips high above you, a sad, weary little thing that catches you off guard. When you try to comprehend what it could mean, you’re senses overload as you are suddenly accelerated to incredible speeds. The ride is intense, but once the shock of going from zero to sixty in mere milliseconds wears off, the rest of the trip seems to feel rather smooth. Your knuckles remain white as they grip into the leather however, and you find yourself grateful that you can’t see anything from the inside of the fold. You’re fairly certain that if you could see how fast you were traveling, your breakfast really WOULD be on the outside of you.

After a dozen or so minutes of flight, you suddenly come under the effects of intense deceleration. The sensation is almost as bad as accelerating; only this time you were threatened to be flung from your hiding spot into some unknown territory, instead of being pressed flat into the top of Silver’s boot. Fortunately, you’re able to hang on long enough to feel Silver plant his feet firmly on the ground. The moment he does, your eagerness to get off the insane ride pushes you to crawl out of your hiding spot and onto the center of your titanic protector’s upper boot.

When you take a look around you see that you are now in…
135112211221113121212112121112.title: A Wild Ride

choices: Make an appearance for both of them; you want to meet Tails properly.
Wait until Tails leaves, and give Silver a surprise appearance.
1351122112211131212121121211121.content:
You only get a cursory glace of your surroundings before the ground is drawn up beneath you. Keeping your balance is all but impossible as Silver’s foot is raised up in the air. He takes a massive step forward, and when his foot finally connects with the ground, the violent shockwave that results sends you tumbling over the edge of his boot and rolling onto the hard, flat concrete floor. You stop on your back, looking up at Silver’s towering body as he takes another step away from you. Apparently he hadn’t seen you yet; which was probably all for the best, since you’d much prefer to explore the new environment you found yourself in before you made your appearance.

You sit up and take a proper look around. The space is humungous, even by Silver’s standards. The ceiling stretched up so high above you that you half expected to see a cloud drift by underneath the rusted panels of corrugated metal. Strong, thick I-beams ran down the center of the ceiling, acting as a spine from which smaller beams spread out perpendicular to it, connecting the edge of the ceiling to it’s central spine. The walls appeared to be made of some thick concrete; exactly how thick, you couldn’t tell, but certainly enough to give a mountain excavating team pause if asked to burrow through it. These walls stretched out so far into the distance that the far wall seemed covered in a light haze, not unlike a mountain range when seen from miles away.

There was something painted on the nearest wall; on top of a round, white base was a wreath of laurels; bordering the edge of the background and colored olive green. Centered at the very top of the symbol was a fluorescent green gemstone, drawn like an ideal cut diamond. Flanking either side of the gem was a pair of stark white wings; their coloration so pure that the background looked tinged with gray by comparison. At the bottom, centered between the two laurel strands was a single, immense gold ring. It caught the light from the nearby industrial lights, and you then realized that it was actually accented with gold leafing, which glittered and sparkled so brightly that it almost appeared to be emanating light of it’s own accord.

However, what really got your attention was the part of the emblem that instantly tipped you off to its owner; the person who, most likely, owned the entire building on which the symbol tagged. Just inside the wreath and following its curvature, two enormous orange tails fanned up and out in opposing directions; much like the small pair or wings splayed inside them. The white tips of the tails extended far past the edges of the laurels, stretching all the way up until the fluffy-looking tips were on level with the top edge of the emerald.

You stand in both awe and befuddlement. What was Silver doing in Tail’s workshop? Did the trip here have something to do with the measurements he took of you back home? When you think on it, it doesn’t make sense; what use would Tails have for measurements on you? The sounds of Silver’s footsteps were noticeably softer as he moved further and further away, but the expansive nature of the hanger meant that you could still hear the echo of his treads off in the distance. You push the questions out of your mind for the time being and scan around a bit; it turns out you were on one side of the central pillars, which seemed to serve as a divider of sorts that separated the hangar into two parts.

The side you’re on is cluttered with various pieces of high tech equipment: some of it on racks and dollies, some of it sticking out of opened crates, and some of it free standing. The larger pieces of equipment come equipped with sturdy metal wheels, presumably for easier transport; one example of this was a huge hydraulic arm that stretched a dozen stories into the air. Abutting the nearby wall is a massive red toolbox, taller than some skyscrapers back home, and far taller than even Silver. Next to the toolbox was a bench, littered with loose tools and other components. A small (by Silver’s standards, to you it looked as large as an entire tool shed), backless shop stool is parked near the workbench, far enough away that it looked like whoever sat in it last rolled back to work on something else and then abandoned the seat there without replacing it.

You make your way forward, using Silver’s echoing footsteps as a guide, but mostly blazing your own trail as you explore the area further. To a normal sized person, this side of the hangar would have been like an obstacle course to navigate through; with maintenance equipment jutting out that had to be ducked under or stepped over, and crates and carts packed so tightly together that one would have to side step in order to pass through the gaps. Thankfully, your tiny size came in handy, as you passed under each hazard with minimal difficulty. Of course, the major downside to your small stature was that covering ground took immensely longer, and so making it through the labyrinth of machinery probably took the same amount of time.

After traveling straight ahead for a bit, you decide to break off and see whet the other side of the hangar looked like. You duck underneath a few carts of aircraft components and sidestep a pallet of motor oil before you make it to the wide-open field on the far side. The entire space, from the far away wall to the support pillars is completely devoid of even a single piece of equipment, making it stand in sharp contrast to the jungle gym of metal and plastic that you just came from. You look down towards the other end of the hangar, and see why this part of it was so clear; in the distance, you see a very familiar looking red biplane parked neatly amid a small collection of scaffolds and carts. You must be standing in the thruway for Tails’ famous aircraft, upon which he taxied his plane out of the hangar and onto the runway, which must have been directly behind you.

Well, even though it wasn’t too difficult to make your way through the clutter, you like the idea of travelling along this open road much better, so you begin to move forward again. Off to your left, you hear quaking footfalls emanate out; though judging by their patterns, Silver isn’t walking normally. The steps stop every so often, then resume again, or get quieter briefly before returning to their normal volume. Why he didn’t just fly over everything from the very beginning was a question that was nagging in the back of your mind as you gradually catch up to his position. Eventually you decide to break into a run, and you quickly overtake his struggling steps.

A few moments after you do, you hear the resonating whine of power tools in the distance. The echo makes it difficult to determine the location of the source until you get closer; by the time you deduce that the sound was coming from somewhere off to your left, it changed from a steady whirling sound to a sharp chorus of crackling and popping. You try to look over the tangle of equipment, and sure enough, a small section of the far wall is illuminated in flickering blue light as welding sounds ring out across the hangar. Using that as your guide, you make your way over to the cityscape of heavy equipment, making it through quickly and ending up in a small, circular open space that brought to mind clearing in the middle of a dense forest.

The young fox boy is standing on a small step latter, with a flat gray welding mask covering his face. He’s hunched over what looks like the engine block of a car, but the design of the car was unlike anything you’ve ever seen before. It had a cabin; roofless, like a convertible, but with a distinctive sweptback windshield. The body looks simply made out of practical, durable steel, with some sections missing and exposing the components underneath. However, what strikes you most about this vehicle is the lack of any kind of wheels; at first you think they could be hidden inside the body of the vehicle, but from what you can tell, the car is sitting perfectly flat on the ground.

Before you can think on it further, Silver suddenly enters your field of vision. The abrupt sighting of the giant teen gives you a jolt; you figured that you would hear him coming before he got here, but apparently Tail’s work was loud enough for the teenaged hedgehog to sneak up on you.

Apparently, Tails doesn’t notice him, as he continues welding for a few more minutes until Silver finally walks up to the car and lightly raps the metallic body with his knuckles. Only then does the blue light disappear, accompanied by the striking hiss of the fuel to the torch being cut.

Without lifting his facemask, the young fox cries out excitedly, his voice muffled behind the metallic headwear. “Oh, Silver! Check this out, I think I almost got it working. Look here, I think I had the inertial dampeners calibrated all wrong last time. Come on, take a look!”

He waves Silver over, the latter stepping over only reluctantly as he’s instantly assaulted with a string of dense technobabble. The teenaged hedgehog doesn’t seem interested in any of it, but he politely keeps quiet and looks at all the things Tails points out.

Like Silver, you tune out the ramblings as well, thinking instead on the big question that had been bugging you ever since you saw the logo on the wall. Should you make yourself known to the boy genius, or hold off on exposing yourself and only surprise Silver with your presence. The experience with Sonic still gives shivers of dread to this day, but you know full well that Tails is nothing like his blue idol. You may have better luck with him; but then again, maybe not.

What do you decide?
1351122112211131212121121211121.title: Welcome to the Jungle

choices: He snatches you up quicker than you can react; what are his plans for you?
He introduces himself politely, and is eager to make your acquaintance.
13511221122111312121211212111211.content:
Nothing ventured, nothing gained. If you really think about it, there’s always going to be a risk when exposing yourself to someone new, and until you get back to your normal size, that risk wasn’t ever going away. If you don’t at least TRY, then what’s the point of ever leaving Silver’s house? You’d be perfectly safe in front of the giant TV, watching reruns of shows while Silver did all the heavy lifting; but that was a life you didn’t want any part of.

In spite of how things turned out, the incident with Sonic was probably the first time since you arrived on Mobius that you’ve ever had any control of anything. It didn’t help your depression that you didn’t have all that much freedom since then, with Silver tightening his leash on you and all. It was frustrating to be cooped up in the house like that; a sentiment that you’re sure Silver didn't understand. He could keep you safe from just about anything, but at what cost?

You aren’t some possession that he can keep locked away somewhere. You could make your own decisions, and if the incident with Sonic was any indication, you can handle consequences too. It was about time Silver realized that.

In spite of all your conviction, you hold back on walking out into the clearing. Tails was still busy boring Silver to tears, judging by the look on his face. You decide to wait until the boy genius was finished talking before making your entrance; but seeing as how the conversation looked to be going on for the foreseeable future, you cross your legs and sit on the cool concrete beneath you.

The minutes tick by, each one passing with a river of technical jargon that was far too complicated for you to understand. Just when you feel like you’re about to nod off, Silver’s voice chimes in to break you out of your stupor.

He says, “Hey Tails, I’m glad you’re excited and everything, but all this is going way over my head. I keep telling you, even though I’ve seen cars like this in the future, I didn’t spend all day working on ‘em. I can only tell you if what you’re doing LOOKS right, not if it’s actually put together correctly.”

Tails pauses. Though you couldn’t see the boy’s face behind his welder’s mask, you can tell his mouth was agape just by the way he stopped mid sentence and froze in his tracks. He lets Silver’s words sink in before moving again.

He rubs the back of his head and says, “Heh heh…yeah, I know, I know. Sorry about that, I just get a little carried away…ESPECIALLY when I’ve been racking my brain on this thing for the better part of a day. When I’m in engineer mode, it’s a little tough to snap me out of it.”

You see Silver smile at that, and he replies, “Nah, don’t sweat it. I’ll tell you what, though; it LOOKS right to me. Does it work?”

Tails practically rips the mask off his face, exposing his adorable, boyish fox face to the open air for the first time in who knows how long. Judging by the beads of sweat on his brow and the disheveled state of the fur on his muzzle, you find it safe to assume that it’s been quite a while.

His sapphire eyes sparkle like gemstones as he says, “You bet it does! Here, take a look!”

The twin tails pick up speed as they are whipped about like helicopter blades; soon, the boy is airborne, flying over the hood and windshield of the car. After he plops himself down in the driver’s seat, Tails expertly manipulates the controls with a practiced hand. In under a minute, the vehicle roars to life; bellowing a mighty mechanical purr that echoes throughout the immensity hangar. You cup your hands over your ears to drown out the worst of it, and oddly enough, you notice Silver do the same.

Then the vehicle’s undercarriage begins to glow. It shines forth a brilliant blue light, illuminating the floor below it. The shade of the light is not terribly different from Silver’s when his powers were engaged, leading you to question what that could mean for your gigantic protector. The light grows more intense, and as it does, the steel body begins to shudder under the power of an unseen force. Then, ever so gently, the car begins to rise.

It lifts off only about an inch or so above the floor, just about high enough so that you could walk underneath it without ducking. It stays suspended on a cushion of air for a few more minutes, until it’s finally brought back down to earth as gently as it had lifted off. As the car powers down, its mighty drumming changes into a softer whine before finally cutting out completely.

Silver’s face brightens in amazement. He says, “Tails, that was awesome! It sounds just like the cars back home now, even when it’s turning off! And I think you got it up a little higher than the last time you showed me!”

Tails jumps out of the car and slaps Silver’s hand in a proffered high-five. Then the young inventor turns and pats the vehicle’s body, making it resonate with deep thuds. “Yeah, that was all the adjustments to the output system I was telling you about. It really helped, but I think I might need to replace the wiring when I find something better; I betcha I can make it fly up in the sky like you said if I just had a few dozen feet of superconducting lines. Then again, if I did that, then I’d have to worry about running a cooling system to keep it below transition temperature…”

“Um…yeah okay,” Silver says, trying to cut the fox off before he went off onto another tangent. “I’ll tell you what, if I come across anything, I’ll be sure to bring it to you. Deal?”

Tails looks back up from his train of thought and smiles. He nods and says, “Deal!”

All of a sudden, you notice Tails eye Silver curiously. He looks the teenager up and down with a furrowed brow, as if inspecting him like a malfunctioning robot. You decide to look him over too from where you sit; upon further inspection, the teenaged hedgehog looked positively littered in small oil splotches, scrapes and patches of messy fur.

The memory of Silver’s awkward footfalls echoing in the distance on your way up here instantly springs to mind. It would seem that your theory was correct; your fearless protector DID have a tough time navigating through the impressive tangle of equipment. Your gut reaction is to snicker at the thought of him inching his way between boxes and crouching underneath beams; evidently, the puny human that he was trying to stifle had an easier time of getting here than he did.

You watch on in amusement as Tails says, “Silver…you didn’t walk through all my stuff to get over here, right? You could’ve just flown over it; I wouldn’t have minded.”

Your giant protector looks down at himself. The instant he does, a deep red blush flushes his cheeks. He gets right to work smoothing out his fur with his hands, causing Tails to utter an adorable boyish giggle that mirrored your sentiments. He walks over to a nearby bench and opens a side drawer; out of it, he produces a clean gray rag.

He chucks it in Silver’s direction from where he stood. The psychokinetic hedgehog catches it with his powers, though he decides to wipe himself down by hand. As he does, he mutters “Heh heh…I guess I did, huh? I-I didn’t really think to do that, honestly.”

Out of nowhere, he stops moving and looks downward. Melancholy breaks across his face and his cheeks grow an even darker shade of scarlet. He speaks in a near whisper; “I’ve…just got a lot on my mind recently.”

Tails looks curious, but doesn’t say anything. Silver doesn’t move for a moment, but then is suddenly stirred by a thought. He reaches into his cufflink and produces the paper he had stashed in there earlier.

“Actually, that reminds me…here’s the measurements you wanted me to get. I did my best, but they might not be accurate enough for you.”

Tails is in the process of walking back when he cracks a confident smirk. It looked as if it was copied and pasted from the boy’s idol, no doubt a mannerism the fox picked up from the blue blur. As he takes the paper from Silver’s hand, he says, “I’m sure it’s perfect. I mean, not to brag or anything, but I HAVE been putting together a car with an anti-gravity suspension from SCRATCH. Building a suit based on measurements is child’s play by comparison.”

Seizing the opportunity, Silver says, “Which says a lot, considering you’re still a kid.”

Tails’s smirk grows wider, and he unfolds the paper carefully to begin reviewing it. “You got that right!”

There was a lapse in the conversation that seemed perfectly suited to make your move. You stand up and make your way out into the clearing. Nobody noticed you, naturally, so you decided to take the initiative. An incredibly tiny screw sat nearby, just shy of Silver’s enormous booted feet. You lift it up and hold it with the blunt end in a reverse grip, the point facing upwards.

Reeling back, you let the screw fly like a javelin towards Silver’s leg. Your aim is true, and it pings off dead center just around his knee. The giant teenager yelps, not expecting to be smarted from down below. He twists around and stands in total awe when he sees you waving up from the floor beneath him.

Tails reacts quickly to the sound of the hedgehog's distress. He looks up, and the instant his big blue eyes gaze on you, they light up in wonder and amazement. He gasps excitedly, but he remains wordless for a few more minutes.

After he does speak, what does he want to do with you?
13511221122111312121211212111211.title: The Twin Tailed Boy Genius

choices: Tails takes you to his home...and asks you to be the subject of some experiments
Tails takes a detour on the way to his house. Where he's taking you is unknown
135112211221113121212112121112112.content:
As Silver stammers in disbelief at your appearance, you see Tails yelp in abject glee. He closes the distance to you very quickly; so fast that he lets a gust of wind wash over you in the wake of his movement. As he stands over you, he leans over and braces his hands on his knees. With mouth agape, he studies you all around, bending his knees slightly to view you at every angle he could.

All the attention immediately goes to your head. It had been such a long time since anyone stared at you with such amazement, and it felt good to finally be noticed by someone other than Silver. You puff out your chest and spread your legs into a wide, akimbo stance, posing as if you were some kind of super hero or the like. To Tails, you probably looked more like an action figure, standing like that.

Unfortunately, the good feelings were short lived; a moment later, the giant boy’s wonderment is cut short by the sound of crashing footsteps. Right next to Tails’s curious face, Silver’s burst into view. His eyes glow with a maleficent fire, and it appears that every one of his hairs is standing on end; his chest fur in particular fanned out spectacularly, giving an even broader look to his already impressive chest.

“What the heck are YOU doing here!”

He must have yelled a bit too close to Tails, or perhaps the boy wasn’t expecting the outburst. Either way, as Silver bellowed at you, Tails ears pressed flat against the top of his head, and his eyes were scrunched shut. When Silver finishes, Tails turns and addresses the hedgehog directly.

“Jeez, what’s your problem? “

Silver is taken aback by the abrupt rebuttal. His anger evaporates in a fit of surprised blinking, and he stares at the fox like he had just noticed his presence. You can see the gears turning in his head as he grasps that you weren’t the only person in the room, and that he had some explaining to do.

He stammers his response. “I…uh…he’s the guy I got the measurements from. He’s supposed to be AT HOME, but…”

Before Silver could finish, Tails cuts him off. He whips back around to you, eyes glimmering with fascination. You can almost feel your face glow with a warm blush; the way he looked at you, you would have thought yourself a superstar, if you didn’t know any better.

“No way…so then YOU’RE the little guy from Earth that Silver’s been talking about! That’s AWESOME!”

He giggles with glee and beams with an adorable, toothy smile. Then he kneels down in front of you and offers you his massive, gloved hand.

In a tone as warm as sunlight, he says, “My name’s Miles, but everybody calls me Tails. It’s very nice to meet you.”

You shake his pinkie with both hands, feeling the softness of his gloves with your palms. You smile back at him; both in reaction to the kindness that he extended to you, and to communicate to him that the pleasure was mutual.

“Oh man, this is SO cool! I can’t believe I finally get to meet you in person! I have so many questions for you…like what’s it like on your world? What’s your technological level? Do you have self-assembling AI constructs and quantum supercomputing? How about…”

Tails prattles on with a seemingly endless string of questions so complex that you can’t even begin to answer them, even if you COULD speak to him. However, at this point, he appeared to be more interested in properly communicating what was on his mind than actually getting an answer. He sat up and looked up to the sky as he mentally scrolled through his infinitely long list of inquiries, no longer paying attention to you.

Seizing the opportunity, you look over at Silver. He’s leaning up against he body of the car, some distance away. You realize when you look over at him that he was already staring at you; when your eyes meet, his brow furrows into a miserable scowl. You can practically feel the anger radiate off him like the heat from an enormous bonfire; it rages about him invisibly, but palpably all the same.

To that, all you care to do is stick up your chin in defiance and revel in the attention you were receiving. If he didn’t like sharing you with other people, than that was just tough for him. You’re old enough to make your own decisions (in fact, you were far older than Silver). Besides that, he had no one to blame but himself for this whole situation. If you had just been given a little bit more leeway, you wouldn’t have had to resort to trickery and sleuthing in order to get a release.

He was obviously only mad because you were soundly teaching him a lesson. No skin off your nose if he didn’t like it.

At long last, Tails exhausts his inexhaustible line of questions and looks back down at you again. Upon looking at you, he laughs with a sheepish smile; he must have realized that you had no way of answering every single one of his questions. You decide to smile back up to him to diffuse his embarrassment; thankfully, it appears to work, as his happy grin returns.

“Wow, this is amazing. I can’t believe you’re really here in front of me. I’ve gotta be dreaming or something.”

Then, his face widens with excitement. “Say, why don’t you come with me to my house. It’s not too far off, we can hang out and maybe get something to eat…you’re probably STARVING since you had to make that long trip from Silver’s, and…”

“Hey, hold on a sec,” Silver interjects, far in the distance. The echoing of his boots hitting the concrete seems amplified by his ticked off disposition. “Look, there’s no way this little guy’s going with you. I have to take him home right now, before something happens to him.”

As if reading your mind and giving voice to your own sentiments, Tails turns around, crossing his legs underneath him and replying “Whaddya think’s gonna to happen to him, Silver? Do you not trust me or something?”

It appears that the teen hedgehog is instantly aware of the gaffe he had uttered, because he looks terribly flustered as he says, “What…no, I trust you Tails. It’s just that…THIS guy has a knack for getting himself in trouble. Don’t be fooled by his adorable looks…he’s a WAY bigger handful than you can imagine!”

Tails turns back around; first eyeing you, and then eyeing Silver again. Finally, he turns around completely and says, “Well, I guess that makes us two of a kind, huh little guy?” His giggle fit is highly infectious, causing you to join in as well.

Silver, however, seems immune to it. He frowns at the pair of you and goes on. “Come on, Tails, I’m serious. Anything could happen to this guy, and I promised him that I’d protect him until I got him back to his world. If anything were to happen to him...I…”

“Look Silver, you don’t have to worry about a thing.” Tails interruption is surprisingly reassuring. The boy only turns his head in Silver’s general direction; the rest of his furry orange body faces you. “He’ll be safe with me for the day: I won’t let him out of my sight. Then, before it gets late, I’ll take him back to your house myself.”

Then he turns to you, again all smiles. “Besides, now that I have him here I can fit him for the suit myself, which means it’ll get done a lot quicker.” He rubs his chin and looks down his muzzle at you.

He says in an exaggerated whisper, “Ya know, maybe we can even get some testing sessions in too.”

Silver gasps in horror and then stomps his foot in protest. Even at this distance, it’s loud enough to ring your ears. “You’ll WHAT!?”

Tails’s shoulders quiver as a burst of laughter erupts from him. You take notice that his tails are swaying at a much faster rate as his good humor escalates. When he finally turns to Silver and stands up, the hedgehog realizes that he’d been played. His cheeks grow red in embarrassment and anger, but they are quickly soothed when Tails touches the older boy’s shoulder.

“I swear Silver, I won’t let anything happen to your friend. I know how much he means to you…and, well let’s just say I know what that’s like, thanks to a certain blue guy we both know and love.”

You can’t see Tails’s expression from where you stood, but Silver’s face gradually softens as the silence stretches longer and longer. Though he doesn’t appear entirely convinced, you figure he must have been satisfied on some level as he finally nods his head in affirmation.

This causes Tails to squeal in delight, so loudly that Silver flinches and scrunches his eyes in response. The fox boy bounds over to you and gets on all fours.

He says, “Okay, so whaddya say little fella, want to hang out with me for the day?”

The choice is exceedingly obvious. You nod your head yes, a smile growing on your face as you watch Tails’s grin extend in tandem. Without another word, he extends his hand to you, palm upwards. You climb onto the boy’s plush platform of a hand and remain standing as he gets up off the floor. He puts his other hand underneath the one you stand on, carefully bracing it as if he were balancing a statue made of glass. He looks at you intently to ensure the ride is smooth, but the air of elation around him betrays his true feelings of wonderment.

He starts walking back towards the car, moving in front of the hood where Silver stood. The boy said his goodbye in passing, never breaking his gaze from you. As you move past, you take a glace over at Silver. There’s a look of doubt and fear plastered on his face, but his eyes seem to say something completely different. Amid all the worry, there seemed to be just the slightest hint of longing mixed in with everything else.

Good, that’s exactly how he SHOULD feel. You look away from him and stick your chin out like you were storming off. Even as you move further and further away, you can feel Silver’s gaze follow you until you finally round a bend out of sight.
135112211221113121212112121112112.title: A New Fox Fanboy

choices: It's a test that involves socks...lots of them!
It's a test that involves another part of his body (Reader's choice)
1351122112211131212121121211121121.content:
Thankfully, Tails was right; his house wasn’t very far away at all. In fact, it only took the boy genius mere minutes to make the trek. Unbeknownst to you, Tails’s house was actually a small abode situated directly next to the hangar that served as his workshop. After you both passed front of the car, Tails had deftly maneuvered through a number of very large and complex engineering equipment until he reached the far left hand corner of the hanger.

The doors that stood there lead to a small corridor, only about a few yards long and about four yards wide. In sharp contrast to the very imposing construction of the hangar, this hallway appeared quaint and practical. As Tails took you down it, you gazed upon the walls and noticed that they were made out of slats of corrugated metal riveted together. Though the materials may have been crude, you could tell by the straightness of the lines of rivets that great care was taken in the corridor’s building.

At the far end of the corridor, a plain looking wood door blocked off the entranceway to Tails’s house. Tails’s footfalls seemed to grow more impatient as he approached the door; by the time he did, he practically threw it open in front of you both.

Even though it was daytime, the fox boy’s home appeared to be rather dark, any windows that filtered in light appeared to be on the far end of the house and out of your view. Your new host took a few steps forward, entering what appeared to be the kitchen and dining room areas. He placed you down on the simple wooden table as gingerly as he would place a flower, and it was only then that he ran back across the room to pull the thin white string that was connected to the lights above.

When the florescent bulbs hummed to life, you were finally able to take in your surroundings properly. You were right in your assumption with this room you are standing in was the kitchen; off to your right, a series of mismatching cabinets adorned the walls above a countertop that looked more fitting as an examination table in a doctor’s office. The rainbow of colors and materials in the kitchen alone made your head spin…evidently, Tails scavenged sets from whatever he could find and simply put them together in a sort of Frankenstein fashion. Even the light fixtures above and the tiles below didn’t match from one to the next.

However, in spite of the fact that their origins may have been drastically different, you can’t deny that the whole set up was carefully put together and lovingly maintained. Everything looked brand new; reflective surfaces were polished to a brilliant shine and the woods sparkled brilliantly with fresh coats of wax and varnish. The tiles below you looked spic and span, even in the grouting.

You turn around to see what was directly opposite the kitchen, but unfortunately there’s not much to look at. The room next to you appears to be the living room, though the majority of it stretched around a bend and out of your sight; what you DID see was a thickly cushioned brown couch and small end table (which, of course didn’t match the couch OR the rug underneath it in the slightest).

You thought the flooring below the couch, which ran from well inside the living room to about a few inches before then end of your table, was some kind of strange green rug. However, upon further inspection, you realized that it was actually some kind of AstroTurf, patterned with pinstripes of light and dark green. You wonder why on earth he would have a rug that looked like that...but then you remember the fox boy’s first appearance in the game series.

Tails gets your attention when he suddenly speaks directly behind you, initially causing you to flinch as the boy spoke in a particularly loud and enthusiastic voice.

“So little guy, whatcha want to do first? I can head to my room and bring out some board games or something…Oh, or I could take you around the house and show you around…OR…”

The boy is cut off by the particularly loud grumblings of your tiny stomach. Your cheeks brighten in embarrassment, but Tails simply giggles it off.

“Oh, yeah; I guess you’re pretty hungry, huh? Well, I think I got just the thing for that.”

His tails begin to spin, and soon the young inventor is airborne, hovering over towards the cabinets. As soon as he opens them, you see that they are littered with a myriad of containers…some of the labels advertise that they are filled with hand wipes, or nails. Still others look like simple glass mason jars; it’s through these that you discern that every container in that cabinet is filled with a myriad of brightly wrapped confections.

Tails first flies over to an adjacent cabinet and produces a large glass bowl. He then hovers back, and begins taking fistfuls of candy out of each of the containers, depositing the pieces in the bowl. Once he’s stuffed it to the brim, he abruptly stops spinning his tails, causing him to drop to the floor with a cacophonous crash. It’s loud enough to cause you to wince, but your smile returns when you see Tails joyous face as he rushes back over to you with his bowl of goodies.

“I don’t really know what you’d like, so I grabbed a little of everything. Here, let me lay ‘em out for ya.” He does so right away, deftly picking different pieces from the bowl and presenting them to you. Once they are arranged in a neat line a few paces away, he pulls a chair closer to him before sitting down, resting his elbows on the table in order to prop up his head by his cheeks.

You can feel his glimmering blue eyes follow you as you inspect all the pieces of candy that lie before you. Each one varied in size from sour sucky candies the height of your waist, to a lollipop that stretched out to about two times your height. After looking them over, you decide to start unwrapping a medium sized piece of chocolate. Though it’s fairly awkward, you do manage to rip the package open yourself.

You happily chow down on your food, highly aware at the bedazzled boy looming over you. Each time you glace up at him and meet his eye, he seems to twitch with glee; though he doesn’t speak a word or otherwise make a sound.

You slowly begin to find the silence awkward, so you decide to strike up a conversation. Of course, you need a pad of paper to help with this, so you sign up to Tails that you’d like a writing implement and something to write on. Much to your surprise, the boy genius looks miffed when he gives his reply.

“Aw man, how could I be so careless? Of course you need something to write on in order to talk to me. Just wait right here, I’ll be right back.”

The boy flies away and around the bend. In the distance, you hear distinct rustling sounds that start and stop at seemingly random intervals. In time, the sounds grow louder and louder; until eventually you hear a loud crash and a feeble interjection of pain from your young host. All’s quiet for a moment, and then you see Tails hover around the bend again, one hand gripping a pencil and sheet of paper, the other one rubbing the back of his head.

He gently places the items in front of you, and you decide to immediately go to work on crafting a message. You had a lot to say to the boy…in truth, while you liked every member of the Sonic cast, there was always a special place in your heart reserved for the orange fox. You fondly remember the hours you would spend playing as him in Sonic the Hedgehog 2, and how, in a way, the boy was just like a kid version of yourself. You watched the boy grow as a character in every game; going from an obedient sidekick playing second fiddle to the titular character, to growing into the very hero he had idolized.

And HE was interested in YOU. A chuckle leaves your lips at the irony of the situation as you scribble your first question into the ground beneath you.

When you finish, Tails looks over your message excitedly, reading it back aloud. “ ‘What were you going to use those measurements for?’ OH, yeah those…well, ya see I kind of promised Silver that I’d make you some kind of protective suit, in order to keep you safe whenever he wasn’t around.”

You tsk in disgust. Of COURSE he would commission Tails for that…his overprotection truly knew no bounds, didn’t it? But before you could get too mad at that, you notice a change in your host’s expression. He looks down at his fidgeting hands, while his perky triangular ears lower slightly and his whipping tails slow considerably.

“But…I didn’t really tell him that I…well, I don’t really have the materials and tools I’d need in order to make it. I was hoping he’d…bring you around one day, and then I’d have an excuse to…hang out with you and stuff.”

He suddenly clasps his hands together in a praying motion, closing his eyes when he speaks again. “Please don’t tell Silver…he’s been nice enough to give me descriptions of future technology. I wouldn’t be able to develop that stuff without his help and…well he’s just a cool guy and stuff and I don’t want him mad at me.”

You quickly write a reassurance to him when he opens his eyes, consoling him that you’ll keep his secret. He looks immensely relieved at first…then he brightens up.

“Well, I may not be able to give Silver what he wants…but from what I’m told, I think I might have something that YOU’D be interested in.” He winks at you, though you’re unsure as to why.

He suddenly stands and places his hands on his hips as he says, “I’ve been itching to learn more about you. Whaddya say about being a test subject in a few experiments? And don’t worry; it’s nothing dangerous or anything. In fact…I bet you’ll like it.” He giggles in that adorable fashion again, but this time you sense the slightest hint of deviousness in his voice.

Just what do these experiments entail, exactly?
